The trail offers different perspectives of the landscapes encountered on the ascent and passes through small seasonal settlements of yak herders. Gunsa is a small village with traditional Sikkimese architecture.

stops.title: Gunsa to Yuksom
stops.description: Complete your trek with a descent from Gunsa to Yuksom. The trail follows a different route through forests and villages, offering a glimpse into rural Sikkimese life. Reach Yuksom by afternoon and celebrate the completion of this challenging trek. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Yuksom to Gangtok
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Gangtok (approximately 6-7 hours). The journey offers beautiful views of the Sikkim countryside. Arrive in Gangtok by evening, concluding this challenging and rewarding Himalayan trek.

data.title: Dayara Bugyal Trek
data.description: Dayara Bugyal Trek is a delightful walk through some of Uttarakhand's most beautiful meadows. The trail is gentle, passing through forests and opening up to vast grasslands with views of Bandarpoonch and other Himalayan peaks. This trek is suitable for families, beginners, and anyone looking to experience the magic of alpine meadows.

stops.title: Dehradun to Barsu
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Barsu (7,450 ft), a journey of approximately 7-8 hours. The route passes through Mussoorie, following the Yamuna River, and offers beautiful views of the Garhwal Himalayas. Barsu is a charming village that serves as the base for the Dayara Bugyal Trek. Overnight in a guesthouse with an evening briefing about the trek ahead.

stops.title: Barsu to Barnala
stops.description: After breakfast, begin your trek from Barsu to Barnala (9,400 ft). The trail passes through dense oak and rhododendron forests, with occasional clearings offering views of the valley below. The moderate ascent takes 4-5 hours. Barnala has a small lake and a temple, and the campsite offers beautiful sunset views of the Himalayan peaks.

stops.title: Barnala to Dayara Bugyal
stops.description: Trek from Barnala to Dayara Bugyal (11,830 ft), one of the most beautiful high-altitude meadows in India. The trail initially passes through forests before opening up to vast meadows stretching over 28 square kilometers. Reach the highest point of Dayara for panoramic views of major Himalayan peaks including Bandarpoonch, Srikanth, and the Gangotri range. Camp amidst the meadows, which are carpeted with wildflowers in summer and covered with snow in winter.

stops.title: Explore Dayara Bugyal
stops.description: Spend the day exploring the vast expanse of Dayara Bugyal. The meadow changes character with the seasons - lush green with wildflowers in summer, golden in autumn, and snow-covered in winter. Visit nearby peaks for even better views of the Himalayan ranges. For winter treks, learn basic snow techniques and enjoy activities like sledding. Return to the same campsite by evening.

stops.title: Dayara Bugyal to Barsu
stops.description: Begin your descent from Dayara Bugyal back to Barsu. The trail offers different perspectives of the landscapes encountered on the way up. Reach Barsu by afternoon and celebrate the completion of the trek. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Barsu to Dehradun
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Dehradun (approximately 7-8 hours). The journey offers last glimpses of the beautiful Garhwal Himalayan landscape. Arrive in Dehradun by evening, concluding this beautiful trek through one of Uttarakhand's most scenic meadows.

data.title: Deo Tibba Base Camp Trek
data.description: The Deo Tibba Base Camp Trek is a classic Himalayan trek that takes you to the base camp of the Deo Tibba, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and glaciers. The trek takes you through beautiful forests, lush meadows, and rocky terrains. This trek is ideal for those looking to experience the raw beauty of the Himalayas.

stops.title: Drive from Manali to Khanol and trek to Chikka
stops.description: Begin with a short drive from Manali (6,725 ft) to Khanol (8,200 ft), the trek starting point. Trek through dense pine, oak, and silver birch forests along the Jagatsukh Nallah to reach Chikka (10,500 ft). Enjoy views of Deo Tibba and Indrasan peaks. Camp beside the river.

stops.title: Chikka to Seri
stops.description: Trek from Chikka to Seri (12,800 ft), a beautiful meadow that was once a glacial lake. The trail passes through boulder fields and rhododendron thickets, with waterfalls and views of Tainta cliffs. Camp in the wide grasslands of Seri.

stops.title: Seri to Tainta
stops.description: Ascend gradually from Seri to Tainta (13,500 ft), crossing streams and moraines. The landscape becomes more alpine, with wildflowers and views of Deo Tibbas snowfields. Camp at Tainta with close-up views of the Deo Tibba massif.

stops.title: Tainta to Deo Tibba Base Camp and return to Tainta
stops.description: Trek to Deo Tibba Base Camp (14,698 ft), traversing moraines and glacial streams. Enjoy panoramic views of Deo Tibba, Indrasan, and the glaciers. Spend time exploring the base camp area before returning to Tainta for overnight stay.

stops.title: Tainta to Chikka
stops.description: Retrace your steps from Tainta to Chikka, descending through Seri and the lush meadows. The downhill walk offers new perspectives of the valley and surrounding peaks. Camp at Chikka beside the river.

stops.title: Chikka to Khanol and drive to Manali
stops.description: Final descent from Chikka to Khanol. Board vehicles for the drive back to Manali, marking the end of the trek. Arrive in Manali by afternoon.

data.title: Deo Tibba Peak Expedition
data.description: The Deo Tibba Peak Expedition is a challenging and rewarding trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking adventurers to the summit of Deo Tibba Peak at an altitude of 19,700 ft. The trek offers stunning views of the surrounding peaks, glaciers, and valleys, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This expedition is perfect for experienced trekkers seeking a true wilderness adventure in one of the world's most spectacular mountain ranges.

stops.title: Arrive in Manali
stops.description: Arrive in Manali (6,725 ft). Meet the expedition team, attend a briefing session, and check equipment. Overnight in hotel.

stops.title: Drive from Manali to Khanol and trek to Chikka
stops.description: Drive to Khanol (8,200 ft) and begin trekking through forests and meadows to Chikka (10,500 ft). Camp beside the river.

stops.title: Chikka to Seri
stops.description: Trek from Chikka to Seri (12,800 ft), a beautiful meadow. The trail passes through boulder fields and rhododendron thickets. Camp at Seri.

stops.title: Seri to Deo Tibba Base Camp
stops.description: Ascend from Seri to Deo Tibba Base Camp (14,698 ft), crossing moraines and streams. Set up base camp with views of Deo Tibba and Indrasan.

stops.title: Rest and acclimatization at Base Camp
stops.description: Acclimatization day at Base Camp. Short hikes to higher elevations, technical training, and equipment checks. Prepare for higher camps.

stops.title: Load ferry to Camp 1
stops.description: Carry loads and establish Camp 1 (16,400 ft) on the glacier. Return to Base Camp for overnight. This aids acclimatization.

stops.title: Move to Camp 1
stops.description: Ascend to Camp 1 with remaining gear. Set up camp on the glacier. Rest and acclimatize.

stops.title: Load ferry and establish Summit Camp
stops.description: Carry loads to Summit Camp (17,700 ft), navigating crevasses and snow slopes. Return to Camp 1 for overnight.

stops.title: Move to Summit Camp
stops.description: Ascend to Summit Camp with all gear. Set up camp and rest. Final preparations for summit push.

stops.title: Rest and acclimatization at Summit Camp
stops.description: Rest day at Summit Camp. Review summit strategy, check weather, and practice technical skills. Hydrate and conserve energy.

stops.title: Summit Attempt (Deo Tibba Peak, 19,700 ft)
stops.description: Pre-dawn start for the summit push. Climb steep snow and ice slopes to reach Deo Tibba summit (19,700 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Pir Panjal and Dhauladhar ranges. Descend to Summit Camp.

stops.title: Contingency day for summit
stops.description: Buffer day for summit attempt in case of bad weather or other delays. If summit is successful, begin descent to Base Camp.

stops.title: Descend to Base Camp and trek to Khanol, drive to Manali
stops.description: Descend from Summit Camp to Base Camp, pack up, and trek down to Khanol. Board vehicles for the drive back to Manali. Expedition ends.

data.title: Deoban Weekend Trek
data.description: The Deoban Weekend Trek is a short and easy trek in the Indian Himalayas, perfect for beginners and those looking for a quick escape into nature. The trek takes you through beautiful forests of pine and deodar, offering stunning views of the surrounding peaks and valleys. Trekkers will experience the vibrant flora and fauna of the region, with chances to spot various species of birds and butterflies. The trek also offers a unique opportunity to interact with the local people and learn about their traditional way of life. This trek is an ideal weekend getaway for nature lovers and adventure enthusiasts.

stops.title: Dehradun to Lokhandi and trek to Saraswati Campsite
stops.description: Drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Lokhandi (7,800 ft), a scenic journey of about 3-4 hours through pine and deodar forests. Begin the trek from Lokhandi, ascending gradually through dense forests with occasional clearings offering views of the Yamuna valley. Reach Saraswati Campsite (8,900 ft) by afternoon. Settle in and enjoy the sunset over the lower Himalayas.

stops.title: Saraswati Campsite to Deoban Top and return to Lokhandi, drive to Dehradun
stops.description: After breakfast, trek to Deoban Top (9,850 ft), the highest point of the trek. The trail passes through thick forests and opens up to panoramic views of the Garhwal Himalayas, including Nanda Devi, Swargarohini, Bandarpoonch, and more than 55 other peaks on a clear day. Descend back to Lokhandi and drive to Dehradun, reaching by evening.

data.title: Deoriatal Chandrashila Trek
data.description: Deoriatal Chandrashila Trek is a versatile trek offering a mix of forests, lakes, and summit views. The highlight is the 360-degree panorama from Chandrashila summit, including Nanda Devi, Trishul, and Chaukhamba. The trail is accessible year-round and is perfect for beginners, families, and photographers.

stops.title: Haridwar to Sari Village
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Haridwar (1,030 ft) to Sari Village (6,600 ft), a journey of approximately 7-8 hours through the mountains of Uttarakhand. Pass through Devprayag, the confluence of the Alaknanda and Bhagirathi rivers forming the Ganges. Sari is a charming traditional village offering beautiful views of the surrounding valleys. Overnight in a guesthouse with a briefing about the trek ahead.

stops.title: Sari to Deoriatal Lake
stops.description: After breakfast, trek from Sari to the pristine Deoriatal Lake (7,850 ft), a moderate 2-3 hour climb through oak and rhododendron forests. The lake offers stunning reflections of Chaukhamba peaks. Spend the afternoon exploring the lake and its surroundings. Camp beside the lake under a starry sky.

stops.title: Deoriatal to Rohini Bugyal
stops.description: Trek from Deoriatal to Rohini Bugyal (8,700 ft), a beautiful alpine meadow. The trail passes through dense forests, small clearings, and offers glimpses of snow-capped peaks. Camp at Rohini Bugyal with panoramic views of the Greater Himalayan ranges.

stops.title: Rohini Bugyal to Chopta
stops.description: Trek from Rohini Bugyal to Chopta (9,600 ft), known as the 'Mini Switzerland of India' for its beautiful meadows. The trail ascends gradually through forests and meadows, with spectacular views of the Himalayan peaks. Overnight in tents or a guesthouse at Chopta.

stops.title: Chopta to Tungnath and Chandrashila, return to Chopta
stops.description: Early morning trek from Chopta to Tungnath Temple (11,800 ft), the highest Shiva temple in the world. Continue to Chandrashila Peak (12,083 ft) for a 360-degree panoramic view of Himalayan peaks including Nanda Devi, Trishul, Kedar Peak, Bandarpunch, and Chaukhamba. Descend back to Chopta for overnight stay.

stops.title: Chopta to Haridwar
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Haridwar (approximately 7-8 hours). The route offers beautiful views of the Garhwal Himalayas. Arrive in Haridwar by evening, concluding this spiritual and scenic Himalayan trek.

data.title: Dev Kyara Trek
data.description: The Dev Kyara Trek is a delightful journey in the Indian Himalayas, taking you through lush green meadows, dense forests, and along sparkling streams. The trek offers stunning views of the surrounding peaks and valleys, and a chance to experience the rich biodiversity of the region. This trek is perfect for nature lovers and those seeking a peaceful escape in the mountains.

stops.title: Dehradun to Sankri
stops.description: Begin your journey with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Sankri (6,400 ft), a picturesque village in Uttarkashi district. The 8-9 hour drive passes through Mussoorie, Purola, and Mori, following the Tons River. Sankri serves as the base for several treks in the region. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Sankri to Boincha via Jakhol (Drive + Trek)
stops.description: Drive from Sankri to Jakhol (7,000 ft), the last motorable village in the Supin valley (approx. 20 km). Begin your trek from Jakhol to Boincha (8,200 ft), passing through pine and deodar forests, and crossing the Supin River. Camp at Boincha, a small clearing beside the river.

stops.title: Boincha to Obra Gad
stops.description: Trek from Boincha to Obra Gad (10,000 ft). The trail ascends gradually through dense forests and opens up to beautiful meadows. Cross several streams and enjoy views of the surrounding peaks. Obra Gad is a wide meadow with a stream running through it, perfect for camping.

stops.title: Obra Gad to Dev Kyara Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Obra Gad to Dev Kyara Base Camp (11,800 ft), the highlight of the trek. The trail passes through lush meadows, rhododendron thickets, and offers panoramic views of Ranglana, Black Peak, and other snow-capped summits. The vast Dev Kyara meadow is surrounded by towering mountains and is a perfect spot for exploration and photography.

stops.title: Explore Dev Kyara Meadow
stops.description: Spend the day exploring the expansive Dev Kyara meadow. Take short hikes to nearby ridges for better views of the valley and surrounding peaks. The area is rich in alpine flowers and offers a chance to spot Himalayan wildlife. Return to base camp for overnight stay.

stops.title: Dev Kyara Base Camp to Obra Gad
stops.description: Retrace your steps from Dev Kyara Base Camp to Obra Gad. The descent offers different perspectives of the landscapes encountered on the ascent. Enjoy the meadows and forests as you make your way back to the familiar campsite.

stops.title: Obra Gad to Jakhol and drive to Sankri
stops.description: Descend from Obra Gad to Jakhol village, passing through forests and riverside trails. Board vehicles at Jakhol for the drive back to Sankri. Celebrate the completion of the trek with your team.

stops.title: Sankri to Dehradun
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Dehradun (8-9 hours), marking the end of your Dev Kyara adventure. Arrive in Dehradun by evening.

data.title: Dhumdhar Kandi Pass Trek
data.description: The Dhumdhar Kandi Pass Trek is a challenging and rewarding journey that takes you over the Dhumdhar Kandi Pass, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys. The trek takes you through beautiful forests, lush meadows, and rocky terrains. The pass itself offers a stunning 360-degree view of the surrounding peaks and valleys. This trek is ideal for those seeking a thrilling and scenic adventure.

stops.title: Dehradun to Gangotri
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Gangotri (10,000 ft), the spiritual source of the Ganges. The 10-12 hour journey passes through Uttarkashi and follows the Bhagirathi River. Overnight in a guesthouse at Gangotri.

stops.title: Gangotri to Bhoj Kharak
stops.description: Trek from Gangotri to Bhoj Kharak (11,800 ft). The trail ascends through pine and birch forests, with views of the Bhagirathi peaks. Camp at Bhoj Kharak amidst alpine meadows.

stops.title: Bhoj Kharak to Kedar Kharak
stops.description: Continue trekking to Kedar Kharak (14,000 ft), a beautiful meadow with panoramic views of Bhrigupanth and Thalay Sagar. The trail passes through birch forests and opens up to high-altitude grasslands.

stops.title: Kedar Kharak to Kedar Tal
stops.description: Trek to the stunning glacial lake of Kedar Tal (15,500 ft), surrounded by towering peaks. The trail is steep and rocky, with breathtaking views of Thalay Sagar reflected in the lake. Camp beside the turquoise waters.

stops.title: Kedar Tal to Gangotri Base Camp
stops.description: Descend from Kedar Tal and trek towards Gangotri Base Camp (14,000 ft), the staging point for the Dhumdhar Kandi Pass crossing. The route traverses moraines and high-altitude meadows.

stops.title: Gangotri Base Camp to Dhumdhar Kandi Base
stops.description: Trek to Dhumdhar Kandi Base (15,000 ft), crossing glacial streams and rocky terrain. The campsite is set amidst dramatic mountain scenery, with the pass visible ahead.

stops.title: Dhumdhar Kandi Base to Dhumdhar Kandi Pass to Kyarkoti
stops.description: The most challenging day. Start early for the steep ascent to Dhumdhar Kandi Pass (18,012 ft), traversing snowfields and rocky slopes. From the pass, enjoy panoramic views of the Gangotri and Yamunotri ranges. Descend to Kyarkoti (13,000 ft), a beautiful meadow on the other side.

stops.title: Kyarkoti to Dokrani Bamak
stops.description: Trek from Kyarkoti to Dokrani Bamak (11,000 ft), descending through alpine meadows and forests. The trail offers views of snow-capped peaks and glacial streams.

stops.title: Dokrani Bamak to Jhala
stops.description: Final day of trekking. Descend from Dokrani Bamak to Jhala (6,400 ft), passing through dense forests and traditional Garhwali villages. Celebrate the completion of the trek.

stops.title: Jhala to Dehradun
stops.description: Drive back from Jhala to Dehradun, marking the end of your Dhumdhar Kandi Pass adventure.

data.title: Dodital Darwa Pass Trek
data.description: The Dodital Darwa Pass Trek is a beautiful and moderately challenging trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the stunning Dodital Lake and over the Darwa Pass at an altitude of 11,400 ft. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks, valleys, and forests, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for those seeking a blend of adventure, natural beauty, and cultural immersion.

stops.title: Dehradun to Sangamchatti (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Sangamchatti (4,800 ft), the starting point of the trek. The journey takes you through Uttarkashi, following the Bhagirathi River and passing through picturesque mountain villages. Overnight stay in a guesthouse or camp at Sangamchatti.

stops.title: Sangamchatti to Agoda to Bebra
stops.description: Trek from Sangamchatti to Agoda (7,200 ft) and further to Bebra (7,800 ft). The trail ascends gradually through forests of oak and rhododendron, passing small villages and terraced fields. Bebra is a beautiful campsite beside a stream.

stops.title: Bebra to Dodital
stops.description: Trek from Bebra to Dodital (10,000 ft), a serene high-altitude lake surrounded by dense forests. The trail climbs steadily, passing through Manjhi, a small settlement with shepherd huts. Dodital is considered sacred and is believed to be the birthplace of Lord Ganesha.

stops.title: Dodital to Darwa Pass and back to Dodital
stops.description: Early morning trek to Darwa Pass (11,400 ft), the highest point of the trek. The trail is steep and passes through alpine meadows with panoramic views of the Bandarpunch and Swargarohini ranges. Spend time at the pass before descending back to Dodital for overnight stay.

stops.title: Dodital to Bebra
stops.description: Retrace your steps from Dodital to Bebra. The descent offers different perspectives of the forests and valleys. Enjoy the peaceful surroundings at the riverside campsite.

stops.title: Bebra to Sangamchatti and drive to Uttarkashi
stops.description: Descend from Bebra to Sangamchatti, passing through Agoda village. Board vehicles for a short drive to Uttarkashi (3,800 ft), a significant town on the banks of the Bhagirathi River. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Uttarkashi to Dehradun (Drive)
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Dehradun, marking the end of your Dodital Darwa Pass adventure. Arrive in Dehradun by evening.

data.title: Doodhpathri Trek
data.description: The Doodhpathri Trek is a stunning and moderately challenging trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the beautiful Doodhpathri Valley, also known as the 'Valley of Milk'. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks, valleys, and forests, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for those seeking a blend of adventure, natural beauty, and cultural immersion.

stops.title: Srinagar to Tangnar
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Srinagar (5,200 ft) to Tangnar (7,200 ft), the gateway to the Doodhpathri region. The 2-hour drive passes through rolling hills and pine forests. Settle into your guesthouse or camp and enjoy an evening walk in the meadows.

stops.title: Tangnar to Doodhpathri
stops.description: Trek from Tangnar to Doodhpathri (8,900 ft), a bowl-shaped valley known for its lush meadows and milky streams. The trail ascends gently through pine and fir forests, opening up to vast grasslands. Camp beside the Shaliganga river and enjoy the starry night.

stops.title: Doodhpathri to Palmaidan
stops.description: Trek from Doodhpathri to Palmaidan (10,200 ft), a high-altitude meadow surrounded by snow-capped peaks. The trail passes through wildflower-filled grasslands and crosses several small streams. Palmaidan offers panoramic views and is a favorite grazing ground for local shepherds.

stops.title: Palmaidan to Diskhal Meadow
stops.description: Trek from Palmaidan to Diskhal Meadow (11,000 ft), traversing undulating meadows and alpine forests. The trail offers breathtaking views of the Pir Panjal range and the valley below. Diskhal is a serene campsite with abundant wildflowers in summer.

stops.title: Diskhal Meadow to Yusmarg
stops.description: Descend from Diskhal Meadow to Yusmarg (7,900 ft), another famous meadow destination in Kashmir. The trail passes through pine forests and offers glimpses of distant peaks. Yusmarg is known for its grassy slopes and tranquil ambiance. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp.

stops.title: Yusmarg to Srinagar
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Srinagar (2 hours). The journey passes through rural Kashmir, offering a glimpse into local life. Arrive in Srinagar by afternoon, marking the end of your Doodhpathri adventure.

stops.title: Buffer/Exploration Day
stops.description: Use this day for rest, local exploration, or as a buffer for weather delays. Optional sightseeing in Srinagar or a visit to nearby Mughal gardens and Dal Lake.

data.title: Dzo Jongo Peak Trek
data.description: The Dzo Jongo Peak Trek is a challenging and rewarding journey in Ladakh, taking you to the summit of the stunning Dzo Jongo peak. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys, and a chance to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for adventure enthusiasts and those seeking a truly unique experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Arrive in Leh (Acclimatization Day)
stops.description: Arrive in Leh (11,500 ft). Spend the day resting and acclimatizing to the high altitude. Explore the local market, visit monasteries, and prepare for the trek. Overnight in a guesthouse or hotel.

stops.title: Leh Acclimatization and Sightseeing
stops.description: Second day in Leh for acclimatization. Optional sightseeing to Shey Palace, Thiksey Monastery, and Hemis Monastery. Briefing and equipment check in the evening. Overnight in Leh.

stops.title: Leh to Lato (Drive) and Trek to Rumak
stops.description: Drive from Leh to Lato (12,300 ft), the trek starting point (approx. 2 hours). Begin trekking along the river to Rumak (13,100 ft), passing through arid Ladakhi landscapes and small villages. Camp at Rumak.

stops.title: Rumak to Lungmaru
stops.description: Trek from Rumak to Lungmaru (14,100 ft). The trail gradually ascends through open valleys and meadows, with views of the surrounding mountains. Camp at Lungmaru.

stops.title: Lungmaru to Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Lungmaru to Dzo Jongo Base Camp (16,400 ft). The trail climbs steadily, crossing streams and rocky terrain. Set up camp at the base of Dzo Jongo Peak, surrounded by dramatic mountain scenery.

stops.title: Rest and Acclimatization at Base Camp
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Base Camp. Short hikes in the area, technical training, and summit briefing. Prepare gear for the summit attempt.

stops.title: Base Camp to Summit Camp
stops.description: Trek from Base Camp to Summit Camp (17,700 ft). The trail is steep and rocky, with thinning air as you gain altitude. Set up camp closer to the summit for an early start the next day.

stops.title: Summit Dzo Jongo Peak (20,472 ft) and Return to Base Camp
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push. Climb steep scree and snow slopes to reach the summit of Dzo Jongo Peak (20,472 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Zanskar and Ladakh ranges. Descend carefully to Base Camp for overnight rest.

stops.title: Base Camp to Lato and Drive to Leh
stops.description: Descend from Base Camp to Lato. Board vehicles for the drive back to Leh. Celebrate the successful climb with your team.

stops.title: Departure from Leh
stops.description: Depart from Leh. Transfer to airport for onward journey, carrying memories of your Dzo Jongo Peak adventure.

data.title: Everest Base Camp (Classic Route)
data.description: The Everest Base Camp Trek (Classic Route) is a legendary journey through the heart of the Khumbu region. Trekkers experience Sherpa culture, ancient monasteries, and breathtaking views of the world's highest peaks. The trail is a test of endurance and spirit, culminating at the iconic Everest Base Camp. A must-do for every serious trekker.

stops.title: Fly from Kathmandu to Lukla, trek to Phakding
stops.description: Take an early morning flight from Kathmandu to Lukla (9,350 ft), the gateway to the Everest region. Begin your trek with a gradual descent through pine forests and Sherpa villages to Phakding (8,700 ft) along the Dudh Koshi River. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Phakding to Namche Bazaar
stops.description: Trek along the Dudh Koshi River, crossing several suspension bridges. Enter Sagarmatha National Park and climb steeply through pine and rhododendron forests to reach Namche Bazaar (11,300 ft), the bustling Sherpa capital. First views of Everest en route. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Acclimatization Day at Namche Bazaar
stops.description: Rest and acclimatize in Namche. Take a short hike to the Everest View Hotel (12,700 ft) or Khumjung village for panoramic views of Everest, Lhotse, and Ama Dablam. Explore local markets and museums. Overnight in Namche.

stops.title: Namche Bazaar to Tengboche
stops.description: Trek along a scenic ridge with views of Everest and descend to the Dudh Koshi River. Climb through forests to reach Tengboche (12,700 ft), home to the famous Tengboche Monastery with stunning mountain vistas. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Tengboche to Dingboche
stops.description: Descend through rhododendron forests to Debuche, cross the Imja Khola, and climb gradually past Pangboche village. Continue to Dingboche (14,300 ft), a high-altitude village surrounded by fields and stone walls. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Acclimatization Day at Dingboche
stops.description: Rest and acclimatize in Dingboche. Optional hike to Nagarjun Hill (16,000 ft) for panoramic views of Makalu, Lhotse, and Ama Dablam. Explore the village and enjoy the high-altitude scenery. Overnight in Dingboche.

stops.title: Dingboche to Lobuche
stops.description: Ascend gradually to Dughla, then climb steeply to the memorials for climbers lost on Everest. Continue along the glacial moraine to Lobuche (16,200 ft), with views of Nuptse and Pumori. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Lobuche to Gorak Shep, visit Everest Base Camp
stops.description: Trek along the Khumbu Glacier to Gorak Shep (16,900 ft). After a short break, continue to Everest Base Camp (17,600 ft), walking on rocky glacial terrain. Celebrate reaching base camp, then return to Gorak Shep for overnight stay.

stops.title: Climb Kala Patthar, descend to Pheriche
stops.description: Early morning climb to Kala Patthar (18,200 ft) for the best sunrise views of Everest and surrounding peaks. Descend to Gorak Shep for breakfast, then continue down to Pheriche (13,900 ft). Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Pheriche to Namche Bazaar
stops.description: Descend through alpine meadows and forests, passing Pangboche, Tengboche, and other villages. Cross suspension bridges and climb gradually to Namche Bazaar. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Namche Bazaar to Lukla
stops.description: Long descent from Namche to the Dudh Koshi River, retracing your steps through Monjo and Phakding. Final climb to Lukla (9,350 ft). Celebrate the completion of your trek. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Fly from Lukla to Kathmandu
stops.description: Take an early morning flight from Lukla to Kathmandu. Enjoy the last aerial views of the Himalayas. Arrive in Kathmandu and transfer to your hotel. Trek ends.

data.title: Everest Base Camp via Gokyo Ri Trek
data.description: This extended Everest Base Camp trek includes the stunning Gokyo Lakes and the challenging Cho La Pass. Trekkers witness turquoise glacial lakes, panoramic Himalayan vistas from Gokyo Ri, and the classic Everest Base Camp experience. The route is demanding but offers unparalleled diversity and beauty in the Everest region.

stops.title: Fly from Kathmandu to Lukla, trek to Phakding
stops.description: Take an early morning flight from Kathmandu to Lukla (9,350 ft). Begin your trek with a gradual descent through pine forests and Sherpa villages to Phakding (8,700 ft) along the Dudh Koshi River. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Phakding to Namche Bazaar
stops.description: Trek along the Dudh Koshi River, crossing suspension bridges and entering Sagarmatha National Park. Climb steeply through pine and rhododendron forests to reach Namche Bazaar (11,300 ft), the bustling Sherpa capital. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Acclimatization Day at Namche Bazaar
stops.description: Rest and acclimatize in Namche. Take a short hike to the Everest View Hotel (12,700 ft) or Khumjung village for panoramic views of Everest, Lhotse, and Ama Dablam. Explore local markets and museums. Overnight in Namche.

stops.title: Namche Bazaar to Dole
stops.description: Leave the classic EBC trail and ascend towards the Gokyo Valley. Trek through rhododendron and birch forests, passing Mong La and Phortse Tenga. Continue the climb to Dole (13,250 ft). Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Dole to Machhermo
stops.description: Trek through alpine meadows and pastures, with views of Cho Oyu and other peaks. Pass through Luza and reach Machhermo (14,465 ft), a small settlement with dramatic mountain scenery. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Machhermo to Gokyo
stops.description: Ascend gradually along the Dudh Koshi valley, passing through rocky terrain and several glacial lakes. Reach the beautiful Gokyo village (15,580 ft) on the shores of the third Gokyo Lake. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Climb Gokyo Ri and explore Gokyo Lakes
stops.description: Early morning climb to Gokyo Ri (17,575 ft) for panoramic sunrise views of Everest, Lhotse, Makalu, and Cho Oyu. Descend to Gokyo and spend the rest of the day exploring the other Gokyo Lakes or resting. Overnight in Gokyo.

stops.title: Gokyo to Thagnak (Dragnag)
stops.description: Trek along the Ngozumpa Glacier, crossing rocky and icy terrain to reach Thagnak (15,580 ft), the base for the Cho La Pass crossing. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Thagnak to Dzongla via Cho La Pass
stops.description: Start early for the challenging ascent to Cho La Pass (17,782 ft), crossing steep rocky slopes and a glacier. Descend carefully to Dzongla (15,900 ft), with views of Cholatse and Ama Dablam. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Dzongla to Lobuche
stops.description: Trek along the lateral moraine of the Khumbu Glacier, with views of Pheriche and the surrounding peaks. Reach Lobuche (16,200 ft). Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Lobuche to Gorak Shep, visit Everest Base Camp
stops.description: Trek along the Khumbu Glacier to Gorak Shep (16,900 ft). After a short break, continue to Everest Base Camp (17,600 ft), walking on rocky glacial terrain. Celebrate reaching base camp, then return to Gorak Shep for overnight stay.

stops.title: Climb Kala Patthar, descend to Pheriche
stops.description: Early morning climb to Kala Patthar (18,200 ft) for the best sunrise views of Everest and surrounding peaks. Descend to Gorak Shep for breakfast, then continue down to Pheriche (13,900 ft). Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Pheriche to Namche Bazaar
stops.description: Descend through alpine meadows and forests, passing Pangboche, Tengboche, and other villages. Cross suspension bridges and climb gradually to Namche Bazaar. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Namche Bazaar to Lukla
stops.description: Long descent from Namche to the Dudh Koshi River, retracing your steps through Monjo and Phakding. Final climb to Lukla (9,350 ft). Celebrate the completion of your trek. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Fly from Lukla to Kathmandu
stops.description: Take an early morning flight from Lukla to Kathmandu. Enjoy the last aerial views of the Himalayas. Arrive in Kathmandu and transfer to your hotel. Trek ends.

data.title: Friendship Peak Expedition
data.description: The Friendship Peak Expedition is a challenging and rewarding trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking adventurers to the summit of Friendship Peak at an altitude of 17,345 ft. The trek offers stunning views of the surrounding peaks, glaciers, and valleys, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This expedition is perfect for experienced trekkers seeking a true wilderness adventure in one of the world's most spectacular mountain ranges.

stops.title: Arrive in Manali
stops.description: Arrive in Manali (6,725 ft). Meet the expedition team, attend a briefing session, and check equipment. Rest and acclimatize. Overnight in hotel.

stops.title: Manali to Solang Valley, trek to Bakarthach
stops.description: Drive from Manali to Solang Valley (8,400 ft). Begin trek through lush forests and meadows to Bakarthach (10,800 ft), a beautiful alpine campsite. Overnight in tents.

stops.title: Bakarthach to Advance Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Bakarthach to Advance Base Camp (ABC) at Lady Leg (12,500 ft). The trail ascends through boulder fields and alpine terrain. Set up camp and acclimatize.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Training at ABC
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Advance Base Camp. Practice technical skills: use of crampons, ice axe, and rope techniques. Short acclimatization hikes in the area.

stops.title: Load Ferry and Summit Camp Setup
stops.description: Carry loads and establish Summit Camp (13,800 ft) on the glacier. Return to ABC for overnight. This aids acclimatization and prepares for the summit push.

stops.title: Move to Summit Camp
stops.description: Ascend to Summit Camp with remaining gear. Set up camp on the glacier. Rest and prepare for the summit attempt.

stops.title: Summit Attempt (Friendship Peak, 17,345 ft) and return to ABC
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push. Climb steep snow and ice slopes to reach Friendship Peak (17,345 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Pir Panjal and Dhauladhar ranges. Descend to Summit Camp and further down to ABC for overnight rest.

stops.title: Reserve/Contingency Day
stops.description: Buffer day for summit attempt in case of bad weather or other delays. If summit is successful, use this day to rest or descend further.

stops.title: Descend to Solang Valley and drive to Manali
stops.description: Descend from ABC to Solang Valley. Board vehicles for the drive back to Manali. Celebrate the successful expedition with your team.

data.title: Gaumukh Tapovan Trek
data.description: Gaumukh Tapovan Trek is a spiritual and scenic journey to the source of the Ganges. The trail passes through Gangotri National Park, with views of Bhagirathi peaks, Shivling, and Meru. Tapovan is a high-altitude meadow with a mystical aura, making this trek a favorite for both adventure and spiritual seekers.

stops.title: Drive from Dehradun to Gangotri
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Gangotri (10,000 ft), the spiritual source of the Ganges. The 10-12 hour journey passes through Uttarkashi and follows the Bhagirathi River. Overnight in a guesthouse at Gangotri.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Exploration in Gangotri
stops.description: Spend the day acclimatizing in Gangotri. Visit the famous Gangotri Temple, explore the local market, and take a short acclimatization hike to nearby viewpoints. Attend trek briefing and equipment check in the evening.

stops.title: Gangotri to Chirbasa
stops.description: Trek from Gangotri to Chirbasa (11,700 ft), following the Bhagirathi River through pine forests and along a well-defined trail. Enjoy views of the Bhagirathi peaks. Chirbasa is a beautiful campsite surrounded by silver birch trees.

stops.title: Chirbasa to Bhojbasa
stops.description: Trek from Chirbasa to Bhojbasa (12,400 ft), the last campsite before Gaumukh. The trail gradually ascends, offering panoramic views of the Bhagirathi range. Bhojbasa is a wide, open campsite with a few ashrams and a clear view of the surrounding mountains.

stops.title: Bhojbasa to Gaumukh and Tapovan
stops.description: Trek from Bhojbasa to Gaumukh (13,200 ft), the snout of the Gangotri Glacier and the source of the Ganges. Continue the steep ascent to Tapovan (14,203 ft), a high-altitude meadow with breathtaking views of Mt. Shivling, Meru, and the Bhagirathi peaks. Tapovan is known for its spiritual significance and stunning scenery. Camp at Tapovan.

stops.title: Explore Tapovan
stops.description: Spend the day exploring Tapovan. Take short hikes to Meru Glacier, visit sadhus and spiritual seekers, or climb nearby ridges for panoramic views. The meadows are dotted with wildflowers and offer a peaceful setting for reflection and photography.

stops.title: Tapovan to Bhojbasa
stops.description: Descend from Tapovan to Bhojbasa, retracing your steps. The descent offers different perspectives of the glacier and surrounding peaks. Overnight at Bhojbasa.

stops.title: Bhojbasa to Gangotri, drive to Dehradun
stops.description: Trek from Bhojbasa to Gangotri, then drive back to Dehradun. The journey marks the end of your Gaumukh Tapovan adventure.

data.title: Georgia Atsunta Pass Trek
data.description: The Atsunta Pass Trek in Georgia is a wild adventure through the remote Caucasus Mountains. This trek features dramatic grasslands, wildflower meadows, and ancient stone villages. Trekkers cross the thrilling Atsunta Pass, explore medieval fortresses, and immerse themselves in Georgian hospitality and culture. The journey is a blend of challenging mountain terrain and rich history, perfect for those seeking offbeat international trekking experiences.

stops.title: Tbilisi to Omalo (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a long and scenic drive from Tbilisi to Omalo, the heart of the Tusheti region. The route crosses the dramatic Abano Pass (9,350 ft), one of the highest drivable passes in the Caucasus. Arrive in Omalo, a picturesque village surrounded by medieval towers. Overnight in a local guesthouse.

stops.title: Omalo to Dartlo
stops.description: Trek from Omalo to Dartlo, a stunning stone village with iconic watchtowers. The trail passes through pine forests, wildflower meadows, and small hamlets. Dartlo is known for its unique architecture and traditional Tushetian hospitality.

stops.title: Dartlo to Girevi via Chesho and Parsma
stops.description: Continue trekking up the Pirikita Alazani valley, passing the villages of Chesho and Parsma. The route follows the river, with views of the surrounding peaks and ancient towers. Reach Girevi, the last inhabited village before the pass.

stops.title: Girevi to Khidotani Meadows (Base of Atsunta Pass)
stops.description: Leave the villages behind and enter wild, remote terrain. Trek through alpine meadows and cross several streams. Camp at Khidotani Meadows, the base of the Atsunta Pass, surrounded by dramatic mountain scenery.

stops.title: Khidotani Meadows to Atsunta Pass to Kvakhidi Meadows
stops.description: The most challenging day. Early morning ascent to Atsunta Pass (11,581 ft), the highest point of the trek, with breathtaking views of the Greater Caucasus. Descend steeply into the Khevsureti region, reaching the lush Kvakhidi Meadows for camping.

stops.title: Kvakhidi Meadows to Mutso
stops.description: Trek through the wild Khevsureti valley, following the river and passing through forests and meadows. Arrive at Mutso, a spectacular medieval fortress village perched on a rocky outcrop. Explore the ancient towers and learn about the region's history.

stops.title: Mutso to Shatili, drive to Tbilisi
stops.description: Short trek or drive to Shatili, a UNESCO-listed fortress village of stone towers and houses. After exploring Shatili, drive back to Tbilisi, concluding your adventure through the wild Caucasus.

data.title: Ghepan Ghat Lake Trek
data.description: The Ghepan Ghat Lake Trek is a hidden gem in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the pristine Ghepan Ghat Lake, cradled at a high altitude. The trek offers a perfect blend of adventure and tranquility, with stunning views of the surrounding peaks and valleys. Trekkers will also experience the rich biodiversity of the region and the unique culture of the local villages.

stops.title: Arrive in Sissu
stops.description: Arrive in Sissu (10,200 ft), a picturesque village in Lahaul Valley. Spend the day acclimatizing, exploring the village, and enjoying views of the Chandra River and surrounding peaks. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp.

stops.title: Sissu to Gangstang Base Camp
stops.description: Begin the trek from Sissu, following the trail along the Chandra River and through alpine meadows. Gradually ascend to Gangstang Base Camp (11,800 ft), with views of Gangstang Glacier and wildflower-filled slopes. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Gangstang Base Camp to Ghepan Ghat Lake
stops.description: Trek from Gangstang Base Camp to Ghepan Ghat Lake (13,602 ft), the highlight of the trek. The trail climbs steeply through rocky terrain and glacial moraines. Reach the pristine turquoise lake, surrounded by snow-capped peaks. Spend time exploring and photographing the lake before camping nearby.

stops.title: Ghepan Ghat Lake to Gangstang Base Camp
stops.description: After a sunrise at the lake, retrace your steps back to Gangstang Base Camp. The descent offers new perspectives of the valley and surrounding mountains. Camp at Gangstang Base Camp.

stops.title: Gangstang Base Camp to Sissu and Departure
stops.description: Descend from Gangstang Base Camp to Sissu, passing through meadows and along the river. Reach Sissu by afternoon, marking the end of your Ghepan Ghat Lake adventure.

data.title: Gidara Bugyal
data.description: Gidara Bugyal Trek is an offbeat adventure to one of the largest and least explored meadows in Uttarakhand. The trail offers solitude, sweeping grasslands, and grand views of the Gangotri and Yamunotri ranges. Ideal for experienced trekkers looking for untouched Himalayan beauty.

stops.title: Dehradun to Gangnani (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Gangnani (7,800 ft), a small village known for its hot springs and views of the Bhagirathi valley. The drive takes 8-9 hours via Uttarkashi. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp.

stops.title: Gangnani to Rikoda (Trek)
stops.description: Start your trek from Gangnani, ascending through pine and oak forests to Rikoda (9,500 ft). The trail offers beautiful views of the Bhagirathi river and surrounding valleys. Camp at Rikoda.

stops.title: Rikoda to Dokrani Bugyal
stops.description: Trek from Rikoda to Dokrani Bugyal (11,000 ft), a lush alpine meadow. The trail passes through dense forests and opens up to vast grasslands. Enjoy the first views of the Gangotri range. Camp at Dokrani Bugyal.

stops.title: Dokrani Bugyal to Gidara Bugyal
stops.description: Trek to the expansive Gidara Bugyal (13,900 ft), one of the largest and least explored meadows in Uttarakhand. The trail climbs steadily, offering panoramic views of Bandarpoonch, Gangotri, and Draupadi Ka Danda peaks. Camp amidst the rolling meadows.

stops.title: Explore Gidara Bugyal
stops.description: Spend the day exploring the vast Gidara Bugyal. Take short hikes to nearby ridges for 360-degree Himalayan views. The meadows are dotted with wildflowers in summer and offer solitude and pristine beauty. Return to the same campsite.

stops.title: Gidara Bugyal to Dokrani Bugyal
stops.description: Begin your descent, retracing your steps to Dokrani Bugyal. The downhill trek offers different perspectives of the landscape and is easier on the legs. Camp at Dokrani Bugyal.

stops.title: Dokrani Bugyal to Gangnani
stops.description: Descend from Dokrani Bugyal to Gangnani, passing through forests and small clearings. Enjoy the last views of the high meadows before reaching the roadhead. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp.

stops.title: Gangnani to Dehradun (Drive)
stops.description: Drive back from Gangnani to Dehradun, marking the end of your Gidara Bugyal adventure. Arrive in Dehradun by evening.

data.title: Goechala Trek
data.description: Goechala Trek in Sikkim is a classic high-altitude trek, famous for its close-up views of Mt. Kanchenjunga and the dramatic Samiti Lake. The trail passes through rhododendron forests, alpine meadows, and remote villages, offering a blend of adventure, culture, and natural beauty.

stops.title: Arrive at Yuksom
stops.description: Arrive at Yuksom (5,700 ft), the trailhead for the Goechala Trek. Explore the historic village, visit the Norbugang Chorten, and prepare for the trek. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Yuksom to Sachen
stops.description: Begin trekking from Yuksom through dense forests of pine, oak, and rhododendron. Cross several suspension bridges over the Prek Chu river to reach Sachen (7,200 ft). Camp in a forest clearing.

stops.title: Sachen to Tshoka via Bakhim
stops.description: Trek uphill to Bakhim (8,600 ft), then continue to Tshoka (9,700 ft), a small Tibetan settlement with beautiful views of the surrounding peaks. The trail passes through lush rhododendron forests.

stops.title: Tshoka to Dzongri
stops.description: Climb steeply through rhododendron forests and open meadows to reach Dzongri (13,200 ft), a high-altitude grazing area with panoramic views of Kanchenjunga and Pandim. Acclimatize and enjoy the scenery.

stops.title: Acclimatization at Dzongri
stops.description: Rest and acclimatize at Dzongri. Early morning hike to Dzongri Top (13,675 ft) for sunrise views of Kanchenjunga, Kabru, Pandim, and other peaks. Explore the meadows and relax.

stops.title: Dzongri to Thansing
stops.description: Descend to the Prek Chu river and then ascend through rhododendron forests and meadows to Thansing (12,900 ft), a wide alpine valley with spectacular mountain views. Camp near the river.

stops.title: Thansing to Lamuney
stops.description: A short and gradual walk through alpine meadows leads to Lamuney (13,700 ft), the last campsite before Goechala. Enjoy views of Mt. Pandim and the surrounding peaks. Rest and prepare for the next day's early start.

stops.title: Lamuney to Goechala Viewpoint 1 and back to Thansing
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the steep climb to Samiti Lake (14,100 ft) and onward to Goechala Viewpoint 1 (15,100 ft) for breathtaking sunrise views of Kanchenjunga. Descend back to Lamuney and continue to Thansing for overnight stay.

stops.title: Thansing to Tshoka
stops.description: Retrace your steps from Thansing to Tshoka, passing through Kokchurang and the beautiful rhododendron forests. Enjoy the changing scenery as you descend.

stops.title: Tshoka to Yuksom
stops.description: Descend from Tshoka to Yuksom, passing through Bakhim and Sachen. Celebrate the completion of the trek in Yuksom.

data.title: Gurez Valley Trek
data.description: The Gurez Valley Trek is a hidden gem in the Indian Himalayas, offering a perfect blend of adventure and tranquility. The trek takes you through ancient forests, charming villages, and pristine alpine lakes. The highlight is the Gurez Valley, with its emerald waters and stunning mountain backdrop. This trek is ideal for those seeking solitude and a deeper connection with nature.

stops.title: Srinagar to Dawar (Gurez Valley)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Srinagar (5,200 ft) to Dawar (8,000 ft) in Gurez Valley. The route crosses Razdan Pass (11,672 ft) and offers breathtaking views of the Kishanganga River and surrounding peaks. Arrive in Dawar, the main town of Gurez, and settle into a guesthouse or homestay.

stops.title: Dawar to Bagtore
stops.description: Trek from Dawar to Bagtore (9,200 ft), a picturesque village near the Line of Control. The trail follows the Kishanganga River, passing through meadows, pine forests, and small hamlets. Camp at Bagtore and enjoy the tranquility of the valley.

stops.title: Bagtore to Patalwan Meadow
stops.description: Trek from Bagtore to Patalwan Meadow (11,000 ft), a beautiful high-altitude pasture surrounded by snow-capped peaks. The trail ascends gradually through forests and open grasslands, with opportunities to spot Himalayan wildlife. Camp at Patalwan Meadow.

stops.title: Patalwan Meadow to Chakwali
stops.description: Trek from Patalwan Meadow to Chakwali (13,185 ft), the last village in the Gurez Valley near the border. The trail climbs steadily, offering panoramic views of the Habba Khatoon peak and the surrounding mountains. Explore the remote village and interact with the local Gujjar and Dard communities.

stops.title: Chakwali to Patalwan Meadow
stops.description: Retrace your steps from Chakwali back to Patalwan Meadow. The descent offers different perspectives of the valley and its pristine landscapes. Camp at Patalwan Meadow.

stops.title: Patalwan Meadow to Dawar and drive to Srinagar
stops.description: Descend from Patalwan Meadow to Dawar, passing through Bagtore. Board vehicles for the drive back to Srinagar, marking the end of your Gurez Valley adventure.

data.title: Hampta Pass Trek
data.description: Hampta Pass Trek is a dramatic crossover trek from the lush Kullu valley to the arid Spiti valley. The trail features river crossings, wildflower meadows, and the thrilling Hampta Pass crossing. This trek is perfect for those seeking variety in landscapes and a moderate challenge.

stops.title: Manali to Jobra and trek to Chika
stops.description: Drive from Manali (6,725 ft) to Jobra (9,800 ft), the trek starting point. Trek through pine, maple, and birch forests along the Rani Nallah to Chika (10,400 ft), a beautiful meadow by the river. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Chika to Balu Ka Ghera
stops.description: Trek from Chika to Balu Ka Ghera (11,900 ft), crossing several streams and boulder fields. The trail offers views of the Dhauladhar range and wildflower meadows. Camp at Balu Ka Ghera, the base for the Hampta Pass ascent.

stops.title: Balu Ka Ghera to Hampta Pass and descend to Shea Goru
stops.description: Climb steeply to Hampta Pass (14,065 ft), the highest point of the trek, with panoramic views of the Lahaul and Spiti valleys. Descend to Shea Goru (12,600 ft), a beautiful campsite in a wide valley. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Shea Goru to Chatru
stops.description: Descend from Shea Goru to Chatru (10,900 ft), crossing glacial streams and rocky terrain. The landscape changes dramatically as you enter the Spiti valley. Camp at Chatru or drive to Chandratal Lake (optional, if road and weather permit).

stops.title: Chatru to Manali via Rohtang Pass
stops.description: Drive from Chatru to Manali via the iconic Rohtang Pass (13,050 ft). Enjoy the changing landscapes from the arid Spiti valley to the lush Kullu valley. Arrive in Manali by afternoon, marking the end of your Hampta Pass adventure.

data.title: Har Ki Doon Trek
data.description: The Har Ki Doon Trek is a delightful and moderately challenging trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the beautiful Har Ki Doon Valley, also known as the 'Valley of God'. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks, valleys, and forests, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for those seeking a blend of adventure, natural beauty, and cultural immersion.

stops.title: Dehradun to Sankri (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Sankri (6,400 ft), a picturesque village in Uttarkashi district. The 8-10 hour drive passes through Mussoorie, Purola, and Mori, following the Tons River. Sankri serves as the base for several treks in the region. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Sankri to Taluka (Drive) and trek to Seema/Osla
stops.description: Drive from Sankri to Taluka (6,800 ft), the trek starting point. Trek along the Supin River through pine forests and small villages to Seema/Osla (8,200 ft), a traditional Himalayan village. Camp near the village.

stops.title: Seema/Osla to Har Ki Doon Valley
stops.description: Trek from Seema/Osla to Har Ki Doon Valley (11,500 ft), a beautiful hanging valley surrounded by snow-capped peaks. The trail passes through forests, meadows, and streams, with views of Swargarohini and Jaundhar Glacier. Camp in the valley.

stops.title: Explore Har Ki Doon Valley
stops.description: Spend the day exploring Har Ki Doon Valley. Options include a hike to Jaundhar Glacier, Maninda Tal, or simply relaxing in the meadows with panoramic views of the surrounding peaks. Return to the same campsite.

stops.title: Har Ki Doon to Seema/Osla
stops.description: Retrace your steps from Har Ki Doon Valley to Seema/Osla. The descent offers different perspectives of the valley and forests. Camp near the village.

stops.title: Seema/Osla to Taluka (Trek) and drive to Sankri
stops.description: Trek back from Seema/Osla to Taluka, then drive to Sankri. Celebrate the completion of the trek with your team. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Sankri to Dehradun (Drive)
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Dehradun, marking the end of your Har Ki Doon adventure. Arrive in Dehradun by evening.

data.title: Kalihani Pass Trek
data.description: The Kalihani Pass Trek is a challenging and rewarding journey in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the stunning Kalihani Pass. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys, and a chance to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for adventure enthusiasts and those seeking a truly unique experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Arrive in Manali
stops.description: Arrive in Manali (6,725 ft). Meet your trek leader and team, check equipment, and rest for acclimatization. Explore the local market and enjoy the mountain air. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Manali to Lama Dugh
stops.description: Begin the trek from Manali, ascending through dense pine, deodar, and oak forests to Lama Dugh (9,000 ft), a beautiful alpine meadow with views of Indrasan and Deo Tibba. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Lama Dugh to Riyali Thach
stops.description: Trek from Lama Dugh to Riyali Thach (11,150 ft). The trail climbs steadily through forests and meadows, offering panoramic views of the Bara Shigri glacier and surrounding peaks. Camp at Riyali Thach.

stops.title: Riyali Thach to Base of Kalihani Pass
stops.description: Ascend from Riyali Thach to the base of Kalihani Pass (13,000 ft). The trail passes through boulder fields, alpine meadows, and glacial streams. Set up camp at the base, surrounded by dramatic mountain scenery.

stops.title: Base to Kalihani Pass (15,748 ft) and back
stops.description: Early morning ascent to Kalihani Pass (15,748 ft), the highest point of the trek. The climb is steep and may involve crossing snowfields. Enjoy breathtaking views of the Pir Panjal and Dhauladhar ranges. Descend back to base camp.

stops.title: Base Camp to Riyali Thach
stops.description: Retrace your steps from the base of Kalihani Pass to Riyali Thach. The descent offers new perspectives of the valleys and peaks. Camp at Riyali Thach.

stops.title: Riyali Thach to Lama Dugh
stops.description: Descend from Riyali Thach to Lama Dugh, passing through meadows and forests. Enjoy the changing scenery as you lose altitude. Camp at Lama Dugh.

stops.title: Lama Dugh to Manali
stops.description: Final descent from Lama Dugh to Manali. Celebrate the completion of your Kalihani Pass adventure. Depart from Manali or stay overnight as per your plans.

data.title: Kalindi Khal Expedition
data.description: The Kalindi Khal Expedition is a challenging and rewarding journey in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the stunning Kalindi Khal. The trek involves crossing high mountain passes, walking on glaciers, and navigating through rugged terrains. Trekkers will be rewarded with breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys, and a sense of accomplishment in crossing one of the less-traveled paths in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Drive from Dehradun to Gangotri
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Gangotri (10,000 ft), the spiritual source of the Ganges. The 10-12 hour journey passes through Uttarkashi and follows the Bhagirathi River. Overnight in a guesthouse at Gangotri.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Exploration in Gangotri
stops.description: Spend the day acclimatizing in Gangotri. Visit the famous Gangotri Temple, explore the local market, and take a short acclimatization hike to nearby viewpoints. Attend trek briefing and equipment check in the evening.

stops.title: Gangotri to Bhojbasa
stops.description: Trek from Gangotri to Bhojbasa (12,400 ft), following the Bhagirathi River through pine forests and along a well-defined trail. Enjoy views of the Bhagirathi peaks. Bhojbasa is a wide, open campsite with a few ashrams and a clear view of the surrounding mountains.

stops.title: Bhojbasa to Nandanvan via Gaumukh
stops.description: Trek from Bhojbasa to Gaumukh (13,200 ft), the snout of the Gangotri Glacier and the source of the Ganges. Continue the steep ascent to Nandanvan (14,600 ft), a high-altitude meadow with breathtaking views of Shivling and Bhagirathi peaks. Camp at Nandanvan.

stops.title: Nandanvan to Vasuki Tal
stops.description: Trek from Nandanvan to Vasuki Tal (16,200 ft), a glacial lake surrounded by towering peaks. The trail traverses rocky moraines and offers stunning views of Mt. Satopanth and Vasuki Parbat. Camp near the lake.

stops.title: Vasuki Tal to Khara Pathar
stops.description: Trek from Vasuki Tal to Khara Pathar (17,000 ft), crossing glacial terrain and moraines. The landscape becomes increasingly rugged and barren. Camp at Khara Pathar.

stops.title: Khara Pathar to Sweta Glacier
stops.description: Trek from Khara Pathar to Sweta Glacier (17,700 ft), navigating crevasses and icy terrain. The route offers close-up views of high Himalayan peaks and glaciers. Camp on the glacier.

stops.title: Sweta Glacier to Kalindi Base
stops.description: Trek from Sweta Glacier to Kalindi Base (18,000 ft), the staging point for the Kalindi Khal Pass crossing. The trail is challenging, with sections of loose scree and ice. Camp at the base.

stops.title: Kalindi Base to Kalindi Khal Pass (19,488 ft) to Rajparav
stops.description: The most challenging day. Early morning ascent to Kalindi Khal Pass (19,488 ft), the highest point of the trek. Enjoy breathtaking views of the Garhwal Himalayas. Descend steeply to Rajparav (16,000 ft), crossing snowfields and glaciers. Camp at Rajparav.

stops.title: Rajparav to Arwa Tal
stops.description: Trek from Rajparav to Arwa Tal (13,800 ft), descending through moraine and rocky terrain. The landscape gradually becomes greener as you lose altitude. Camp near the lake.

stops.title: Arwa Tal to Ghastoli
stops.description: Trek from Arwa Tal to Ghastoli (12,000 ft), following the Arwa valley. The trail passes through alpine meadows and offers views of distant peaks. Ghastoli is a small settlement with an ITBP post. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Ghastoli to Mana, drive to Badrinath
stops.description: Trek from Ghastoli to Mana (10,200 ft), the last village before the Tibetan border. The trail descends gradually, passing through meadows and small streams. From Mana, drive to Badrinath (10,200 ft), a major pilgrimage site. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Badrinath to Rishikesh/Dehradun (Drive)
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Rishikesh or Dehradun, marking the end of your Kalindi Khal Expedition. Arrive by evening.

data.title: Kanamo Peak Trek Expedition
data.description: The Kanamo Peak Trek Expedition is a challenging and rewarding trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking adventurers to the summit of Kanamo Peak at an altitude of 19,553 ft. The trek offers stunning views of the surrounding peaks, glaciers, and valleys, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This expedition is perfect for experienced trekkers seeking a true wilderness adventure in one of the world's most spectacular mountain ranges.

stops.title: Arrive in Kaza (Acclimatization Day)
stops.description: Arrive in Kaza (12,000 ft), the administrative center of Spiti Valley. Spend the day acclimatizing to the high altitude, exploring the local market, and visiting nearby monasteries such as Key and Kibber. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Kaza to Kibber (Drive) and Trek to Kanamo Base Camp
stops.description: Drive from Kaza to Kibber (14,100 ft), one of the highest inhabited villages in the world. Begin trekking from Kibber to Kanamo Base Camp (15,750 ft), passing through high-altitude meadows and grazing grounds. Set up camp at the base of Kanamo Peak.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Training at Base Camp
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Kanamo Base Camp. Take short hikes in the area, practice using trekking and mountaineering equipment, and receive a briefing on the summit attempt. Hydrate well and rest for the next day's climb.

stops.title: Summit Kanamo Peak (19,553 ft) and return to Base Camp
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push. Climb steep scree and snow slopes to reach the summit of Kanamo Peak (19,553 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Spiti and Ladakh ranges. Descend carefully back to Base Camp for overnight rest.

stops.title: Base Camp to Kibber and drive to Kaza
stops.description: Descend from Kanamo Base Camp to Kibber village. Board vehicles for the drive back to Kaza. Celebrate the successful expedition with your team.

stops.title: Buffer/Contingency Day
stops.description: Buffer day for summit attempt in case of bad weather or other delays. If the summit was successful earlier, use this day to explore Kaza and nearby villages.

stops.title: Departure from Kaza
stops.description: Depart from Kaza for your onward journey, carrying memories of your Kanamo Peak adventure.

data.title: Kang Yatse 2 Trek
data.description: The Kang Yatse 2 Trek is a challenging yet rewarding journey that takes you to the summit of Kang Yatse 2, offering breathtaking views of the Himalayan ranges. The trek takes you through beautiful forests, lush meadows, and rocky terrains. The summit offers a stunning 360-degree view of the surrounding peaks and valleys. This trek is ideal for those seeking a thrilling and scenic adventure.

stops.title: Arrive in Leh (Acclimatization Day)
stops.description: Arrive in Leh (11,500 ft). Rest and acclimatize to the high altitude. Explore the local market and monasteries if time permits. Overnight in a guesthouse or hotel.

stops.title: Leh Acclimatization and Sightseeing
stops.description: Second day in Leh for acclimatization. Optional sightseeing to Shey Palace, Thiksey Monastery, and Hemis Monastery. Briefing and equipment check in the evening. Overnight in Leh.

stops.title: Leh to Chilling (Drive) and trek to Skiu
stops.description: Drive from Leh to Chilling (10,400 ft), the trek starting point. Cross the Zanskar River and trek along the Markha Valley to Skiu (11,150 ft). Camp overnight.

stops.title: Skiu to Markha
stops.description: Trek along the Markha River, crossing several streams and passing through small villages and barley fields. Reach Markha (12,370 ft), the largest village in the valley. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Markha to Thachungtse
stops.description: Continue trekking through the Markha Valley, passing monasteries and mani walls. Gradual ascent to Thachungtse (13,300 ft), a beautiful campsite surrounded by mountains.

stops.title: Thachungtse to Nimaling
stops.description: Trek from Thachungtse to Nimaling (15,400 ft), the high-altitude grazing ground for local herders. The trail offers spectacular views of Kang Yatse massif. Camp at Nimaling.

stops.title: Nimaling to Kang Yatse 2 Base Camp
stops.description: Short trek from Nimaling to Kang Yatse 2 Base Camp (16,730 ft). Set up camp and rest. Briefing and technical training for the summit attempt.

stops.title: Rest and Training at Base Camp
stops.description: Acclimatization and technical training day at Base Camp. Practice using crampons, ice axe, and ropes. Short acclimatization hikes in the area. Prepare for the summit push.

stops.title: Summit Kang Yatse 2 (20,570 ft) and return to Base Camp
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push. Climb steep snow and scree slopes to reach the summit of Kang Yatse 2 (20,570 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Zanskar and Ladakh ranges. Descend carefully back to Base Camp.

stops.title: Base Camp to Chokdo via Kongmaru La, drive to Leh
stops.description: Trek from Base Camp over Kongmaru La Pass (17,060 ft), the highest pass on the route, with spectacular views. Descend to Chokdo (13,100 ft) and drive back to Leh. Overnight in Leh.

stops.title: Departure from Leh
stops.description: Depart from Leh for your onward journey, carrying memories of your Kang Yatse 2 adventure.

data.title: Kareri Lake Trek
data.description: The Kareri Lake Trek is a beautiful and easy trek in the Indian Himalayas, perfect for beginners and nature enthusiasts. The trek takes you to the serene Kareri Lake, offering stunning views of the surrounding peaks and valleys. Trekkers will experience the vibrant flora and fauna of the region, with chances to spot various species of birds and butterflies. The trek also offers a unique opportunity to interact with the local shepherds and learn about their traditional way of life. This trek is a perfect escape into the serene and pristine beauty of the Himalayas.

stops.title: Dharamkot/Mcleodganj to Kareri Village
stops.description: Arrive in Dharamkot or Mcleodganj (6,800 ft). Drive or trek to Kareri Village (7,200 ft), a traditional Himachali village. Acclimatize, explore the village, and enjoy views of the Dhauladhar range. Overnight in a homestay or camp.

stops.title: Kareri Village to Kareri Lake
stops.description: Trek from Kareri Village to Kareri Lake (9,650 ft). The trail follows the Nyund stream, passing through pine, oak, and rhododendron forests, and crossing wooden bridges. Reach the pristine Kareri Lake, surrounded by high mountains and meadows. Camp by the lakeside.

stops.title: Kareri Lake to Kareri Village and return to Dharamkot/Mcleodganj
stops.description: After sunrise at the lake, retrace your steps back to Kareri Village. Descend through forests and meadows, then drive or trek back to Dharamkot/Mcleodganj, marking the end of your Kareri Lake adventure.

data.title: Kashmir Great Lakes Trek
data.description: Kashmir Great Lakes Trek is a visual feast, with a series of stunning alpine lakes set against the backdrop of snow-capped peaks. The trail meanders through meadows, ridges, and remote valleys, showcasing the best of Kashmir's natural beauty. A must-do for every trekker seeking Himalayan grandeur.

stops.title: Srinagar to Sonamarg (Drive)
stops.description: Arrive in Srinagar (5,200 ft) and drive to Sonamarg (7,800 ft), the starting point of the trek. The drive takes about 3-4 hours along the Sindh River, passing through scenic valleys and villages. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp at Sonamarg.

stops.title: Sonamarg to Nichnai via Shekdur
stops.description: Begin trekking from Sonamarg, ascending through lush meadows and pine forests to Shekdur. Continue to Nichnai (11,500 ft), a beautiful campsite in a wide valley surrounded by mountains. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Nichnai to Vishansar Lake via Nichnai Pass
stops.description: Climb to Nichnai Pass (13,100 ft), the first major pass of the trek, with panoramic views of the surrounding peaks. Descend to the Vishansar Valley and camp near the stunning Vishansar Lake (12,000 ft).

stops.title: Vishansar Lake to Gadsar via Kishansar Lake and Gadsar Pass
stops.description: Trek past Kishansar Lake and ascend to Gadsar Pass (13,800 ft), the highest point of the trek. Enjoy breathtaking views of the twin lakes and surrounding mountains. Descend to Gadsar Lake (12,200 ft), a pristine alpine lake. Camp nearby.

stops.title: Gadsar to Satsar
stops.description: Trek through meadows and cross a few small streams to reach Satsar (12,000 ft), a group of seven alpine lakes. The trail passes through remote valleys and offers solitude and stunning scenery. Camp at Satsar.

stops.title: Satsar to Gangbal via Zaj Pass
stops.description: Ascend to Zaj Pass (13,100 ft), with spectacular views of the Harmukh peak and the twin lakes of Gangbal and Nundkol. Descend to the shores of Gangbal Lake (11,500 ft), the largest lake on the trek. Camp between Gangbal and Nundkol lakes.

stops.title: Gangbal to Naranag, drive to Srinagar
stops.description: Descend from Gangbal to Naranag (7,450 ft) through pine forests and ancient temple ruins. The trek ends at Naranag, from where you drive back to Srinagar. Arrive in Srinagar by evening.

stops.title: Buffer/Exploration Day
stops.description: Buffer day for weather delays or to explore Srinagar. Optional sightseeing: Dal Lake, Mughal Gardens, or local markets.

data.title: Kedar Tal Trek
data.description: The Kedar Tal Trek is a challenging and rewarding trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the stunning Kedar Tal Lake at an altitude of 15,500 ft. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks, valleys, and glaciers, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for those seeking a blend of adventure, natural beauty, and cultural immersion.

stops.title: Drive from Dehradun to Gangotri
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Gangotri (10,000 ft), the starting point of the trek. The journey takes you through Uttarkashi and along the Bhagirathi River. Overnight in a guesthouse at Gangotri.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Exploration in Gangotri
stops.description: Spend the day acclimatizing in Gangotri. Visit the Gangotri Temple, explore the local market, and take a short acclimatization hike to nearby viewpoints. Attend trek briefing and equipment check in the evening.

stops.title: Gangotri to Bhoj Kharak
stops.description: Trek from Gangotri to Bhoj Kharak (11,800 ft). The trail ascends steeply through pine and birch forests, with views of the Bhagirathi peaks. Camp at Bhoj Kharak amidst alpine meadows.

stops.title: Bhoj Kharak to Kedar Kharak
stops.description: Continue trekking to Kedar Kharak (14,000 ft), a beautiful meadow with panoramic views of Bhrigupanth and Thalay Sagar. The trail passes through birch forests and opens up to high-altitude grasslands.

stops.title: Kedar Kharak to Kedar Tal
stops.description: Trek to the stunning glacial lake of Kedar Tal (15,500 ft), surrounded by towering peaks. The trail is steep and rocky, with breathtaking views of Thalay Sagar reflected in the lake. Camp beside the turquoise waters.

stops.title: Kedar Tal to Bhoj Kharak
stops.description: Descend from Kedar Tal to Bhoj Kharak, retracing your steps. The downhill trek offers different perspectives of the dramatic landscape.

stops.title: Bhoj Kharak to Gangotri, drive to Dehradun
stops.description: Trek back from Bhoj Kharak to Gangotri. After lunch, drive to Dehradun, marking the end of your Kedar Tal adventure.

data.title: Kedarkantha Trek
data.description: The Kedarkantha Trek is a popular winter trek in India, known for its stunning snow-covered landscapes and panoramic views of the Himalayan peaks. The trek takes you through beautiful pine forests, charming villages, and pristine meadows. The summit of Kedarkantha offers a breathtaking view of the surrounding peaks and valleys. This trek is ideal for those looking to experience the beauty of the Himalayas in winter.

stops.title: Dehradun to Sankri (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Sankri (6,400 ft), a picturesque village in Uttarkashi district. The 8-10 hour drive passes through Mussoorie, Purola, and Mori, following the Tons River. Sankri serves as the base for several treks in the region. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Sankri to Juda Ka Talab
stops.description: Trek from Sankri to Juda Ka Talab (9,000 ft), a beautiful high-altitude lake surrounded by pine forests. The trail ascends gradually through dense woods and opens up to a serene campsite by the lake. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Juda Ka Talab to Kedarkantha Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Juda Ka Talab to Kedarkantha Base Camp (11,200 ft). The trail climbs steadily through pine and oak forests, offering glimpses of snow-capped peaks. Set up camp at the base of Kedarkantha, with panoramic mountain views.

stops.title: Base Camp to Kedarkantha Summit and descend to Hargaon
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push to Kedarkantha Peak (12,500 ft). Enjoy breathtaking 360-degree views of the Himalayas from the top. Descend to Hargaon (8,900 ft) for overnight camp in a forest clearing.

stops.title: Hargaon to Sankri
stops.description: Descend from Hargaon to Sankri, passing through pine forests and small clearings. Celebrate the completion of your trek in Sankri. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Sankri to Dehradun (Drive)
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Dehradun, marking the end of your Kedarkantha adventure. Arrive in Dehradun by evening.

data.title: Khopra Ridge Trek
data.description: Khopra Ridge Trek in Nepal is an offbeat alternative to the Annapurna Base Camp trek. The trail offers spectacular ridge walks, views of Dhaulagiri and Annapurna, and the sacred Khayar Lake. Trekkers experience authentic village life and diverse landscapes, making it a rewarding Himalayan journey.

stops.title: Drive from Pokhara to Nayapul, trek to Ghandruk
stops.description: Drive from Pokhara to Nayapul (1,070 m), then trek through terraced fields and traditional villages to Ghandruk (1,940 m), a large Gurung village with stunning views of Annapurna South and Machapuchare. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Ghandruk to Tadapani
stops.description: Trek through rhododendron and oak forests, with occasional views of the Annapurna range. Reach Tadapani (2,630 m), a small settlement with panoramic mountain views. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Tadapani to Dobato
stops.description: Leave the main trail and ascend through dense forests and open meadows to Dobato (3,420 m). Enjoy sunset views of Dhaulagiri and Annapurna ranges from Muldai View Point. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Dobato to Upper Chistibung
stops.description: Trek through rhododendron forests and alpine pastures to Upper Chistibung (2,975 m). The trail is less crowded and offers chances to spot Himalayan monal and other wildlife. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Upper Chistibung to Khopra Ridge
stops.description: Ascend above the tree line to Khopra Ridge (3,660 m), with breathtaking views of Dhaulagiri, Annapurna South, Nilgiri, and more. Explore the ridge and enjoy the dramatic scenery. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Khopra Ridge to Khayar Lake (optional) and back
stops.description: Optional day hike to the sacred Khayar Lake (4,660 m), a challenging but rewarding excursion with spectacular mountain views. Return to Khopra Ridge for overnight stay.

stops.title: Khopra Ridge to Swanta
stops.description: Descend through alpine meadows and forests to Swanta (2,200 m), a traditional Magar village. Enjoy views of Dhaulagiri and experience local culture. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Swanta to Ghorepani
stops.description: Trek through terraced fields and forests to Ghorepani (2,850 m), a popular stop on the Annapurna circuit. Option to hike to Poon Hill for sunset views. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Ghorepani to Nayapul, drive to Pokhara
stops.description: Early morning hike to Poon Hill (3,210 m) for sunrise views (optional). Descend through forests and villages to Nayapul, then drive back to Pokhara. Trek ends.

data.title: Kilimanjaro Peak Trek Expedition
