data.description: The Kilimanjaro Peak Trek Expedition is the ultimate challenge for trekkers and adventurers, taking you to the summit of Mount Kilimanjaro, the highest peak in Africa, at an altitude of 19,341 ft. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscapes, including savannahs, rainforests, and alpine deserts, and takes you through a diverse range of ecosystems and climates. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This expedition is perfect for those seeking a true adventure of a lifetime in one of the world's most spectacular and diverse mountain ranges.

stops.title: Arrive in Moshi
stops.description: Arrive in Moshi, Tanzania (2,800 ft), the gateway town for Kilimanjaro. Meet your trek leader and team, attend a briefing, and check equipment. Rest and acclimatize. Overnight in a hotel.

stops.title: Moshi to Machame Gate, trek to Machame Camp
stops.description: Drive from Moshi to Machame Gate (5,900 ft). Begin trekking through lush rainforest to Machame Camp (9,850 ft). Spot unique flora and possibly colobus monkeys. Overnight in tents.

stops.title: Machame Camp to Shira Camp
stops.description: Trek out of the rainforest and into moorland. Ascend to Shira Camp (12,500 ft) on the Shira Plateau, with views of Kibo Peak. Overnight in tents.

stops.title: Shira Camp to Barranco Camp via Lava Tower
stops.description: Ascend to Lava Tower (15,190 ft) for acclimatization, then descend to Barranco Camp (13,044 ft) below the Barranco Wall. The day helps with altitude adaptation. Overnight in tents.

stops.title: Barranco Camp to Karanga Camp
stops.description: Climb the Barranco Wall, then trek through alpine desert to Karanga Camp (13,250 ft). Enjoy views of the southern glaciers and summit. Overnight in tents.

stops.title: Karanga Camp to Barafu Camp
stops.description: Trek to Barafu Camp (15,330 ft), the base for the summit push. Rest, hydrate, and prepare for the early morning ascent. Overnight in tents.

stops.title: Barafu Camp to Uhuru Peak (Summit) and descend to Mweka Camp
stops.description: Start around midnight for the summit push. Climb via Stella Point (18,885 ft) to Uhuru Peak (19,341 ft), the highest point in Africa. After summit photos, descend to Barafu for a short rest, then continue down to Mweka Camp (10,170 ft). Overnight in tents.

stops.title: Mweka Camp to Mweka Gate, drive to Moshi
stops.description: Descend through rainforest to Mweka Gate (5,380 ft). Receive summit certificates, then drive back to Moshi. Celebrate your achievement. Overnight in a hotel.

stops.title: Departure from Moshi
stops.description: Depart from Moshi for your onward journey, carrying memories of your Kilimanjaro adventure.

data.title: Kuari Pass Trek
data.description: Kuari Pass Trek is a historic trail, once traversed by Lord Curzon, offering grand views of Nanda Devi, Kamet, and Dronagiri. The trek features oak forests, alpine meadows, and charming campsites, making it suitable for beginners and those seeking classic Himalayan vistas.

stops.title: Drive from Rishikesh/Haridwar to Joshimath
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Rishikesh/Haridwar (1,030 ft) to Joshimath (6,725 ft), gateway to the Garhwal Himalayas. The 8-10 hour journey passes through Devprayag, Rudraprayag, and Chamoli, following the Alaknanda River. Overnight in a guesthouse or hotel at Joshimath.

stops.title: Joshimath to Dhak, trek to Gulling
stops.description: Drive from Joshimath to Dhak (6,890 ft), the trek starting point. Trek through mountain villages and terraced fields, gradually ascending to Gulling (9,200 ft). Enjoy views of Dronagiri and Hathi Parvat. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Gulling to Tali
stops.description: Trek from Gulling to Tali (10,500 ft), passing through oak, rhododendron, and conifer forests. The trail offers glimpses of Nanda Devi and other peaks. Camp at Tali, a beautiful clearing in the forest.

stops.title: Tali to Kuari Pass and return to Tali
stops.description: Trek from Tali to Kuari Pass (12,516 ft), the highest point of the trek. The trail traverses alpine meadows with grand views of Nanda Devi, Kamet, Dronagiri, and more. Spend time at the pass, then return to Tali for overnight camp.

stops.title: Tali to Auli, drive to Joshimath
stops.description: Descend from Tali to Auli (8,200 ft), passing through Gorson Bugyal, a vast alpine meadow. Enjoy panoramic views of the Garhwal Himalayas. From Auli, drive back to Joshimath for overnight stay.

stops.title: Joshimath to Rishikesh/Haridwar (Drive)
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Rishikesh/Haridwar, marking the end of your Kuari Pass adventure. Arrive by evening.

data.title: Marchoi Trek
data.description: The Marchoi Trek is a hidden gem in the Indian Himalayas, offering a perfect blend of adventure and tranquility. The trek takes you through ancient forests, charming villages, and pristine alpine lakes. The highlight is the Marchoi Lake, which reflects the surrounding peaks, creating a mesmerizing sight. This trek is ideal for those seeking solitude and a deeper connection with nature.

stops.title: Srinagar to Naranag, trek to Dumail
stops.description: Drive from Srinagar (5,200 ft) to Naranag (7,450 ft), a scenic journey of about 2-3 hours. Begin trekking along the Wangath River through pine forests to Dumail (8,200 ft), a beautiful riverside campsite. Overnight in tents.

stops.title: Dumail to Marchoi Meadow
stops.description: Trek from Dumail to Marchoi Meadow (10,500 ft), passing through dense forests, wooden bridges, and open grasslands. The trail offers views of snow-capped peaks and the pristine Marchoi stream. Camp in the vast meadow.

stops.title: Explore Marchoi Lake and return to Dumail
stops.description: Day hike to the hidden Marchoi Lake, surrounded by alpine scenery and wildflowers (in season). Spend time exploring and photographing the lake, then descend back to Dumail for overnight camp.

stops.title: Dumail to Naranag, drive to Srinagar
stops.description: Retrace your steps from Dumail to Naranag. Board vehicles for the drive back to Srinagar, marking the end of your Marchoi Trek.

data.title: Markha Valley Trek
data.description: The Markha Valley Trek is a mesmerizing journey that takes you through the stunning landscapes of the Markha Valley in Ladakh. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys. Trekkers will enjoy walking through ancient monasteries, charming villages, and pristine landscapes. This trek is ideal for those looking to experience the unique culture and breathtaking beauty of Ladakh.

stops.title: Leh to Chilling (Drive), trek to Skiu
stops.description: Drive from Leh to Chilling (10,400 ft), the starting point of the trek. Cross the Zanskar River and trek along the Markha Valley to Skiu (11,150 ft), passing through narrow gorges and rocky terrain. Camp overnight at Skiu.

stops.title: Skiu to Markha
stops.description: Trek along the Markha River, crossing several streams and passing through small villages and barley fields. Reach Markha (12,370 ft), the largest village in the valley. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Markha to Hankar
stops.description: Continue trekking through the Markha Valley, passing monasteries and mani walls. Gradual ascent to Hankar (13,100 ft), a small settlement surrounded by dramatic rock formations. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Hankar to Nimaling
stops.description: Trek from Hankar to Nimaling (15,400 ft), the high-altitude grazing ground for local herders. The trail offers spectacular views of Kang Yatse massif. Camp at Nimaling.

stops.title: Nimaling to Chokdo via Kongmaru La
stops.description: Climb to Kongmaru La Pass (17,070 ft), the highest point of the trek, with panoramic views of the Zanskar and Ladakh ranges. Descend steeply to Chokdo (12,100 ft), passing through narrow gorges. Trek ends at Chokdo.

stops.title: Chokdo to Leh (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Chokdo back to Leh. Celebrate the completion of your Markha Valley adventure.

data.title: Mentok Kangri II Trek
data.description: The Mentok Kangri II Trek is a challenging journey that takes you to the summit of Mentok Kangri II, offering breathtaking views of the Himalayan ranges. The trek takes you through beautiful forests, lush meadows, and rocky terrains. The summit offers a stunning 360-degree view of the surrounding peaks and valleys. This trek is ideal for those seeking a thrilling and scenic adventure.

stops.title: Arrive in Leh (Acclimatization Day)
stops.description: Arrive in Leh (11,500 ft). Rest and acclimatize to the high altitude. Explore the local market and monasteries if time permits. Overnight in a guesthouse or hotel.

stops.title: Leh Acclimatization and Sightseeing
stops.description: Second day in Leh for acclimatization. Optional sightseeing to Shey Palace, Thiksey Monastery, and Hemis Monastery. Briefing and equipment check in the evening. Overnight in Leh.

stops.title: Leh to Karzok (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Leh to Karzok (14,950 ft), a remote village on the banks of Tso Moriri Lake. The journey offers stunning views of the Changthang plateau and high-altitude lakes. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp at Karzok.

stops.title: Karzok to Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Karzok to Mentok Kangri II Base Camp (17,060 ft). The trail ascends gradually through high-altitude meadows and rocky terrain, with views of Tso Moriri and surrounding peaks. Set up camp at the base.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Training at Base Camp
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Base Camp. Practice using technical equipment, review summit strategy, and take short acclimatization hikes. Prepare for the summit attempt.

stops.title: Summit Mentok Kangri II (20,505 ft) and return to Base Camp
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push. Climb steep scree and snow slopes to reach the summit of Mentok Kangri II (20,505 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of Tso Moriri, the Changthang plateau, and distant Himalayan peaks. Descend carefully back to Base Camp.

stops.title: Buffer/Contingency Day
stops.description: Buffer day for summit attempt in case of bad weather or other delays. If the summit was successful earlier, use this day to rest or explore the area.

stops.title: Base Camp to Karzok
stops.description: Descend from Base Camp to Karzok, retracing your steps through the high-altitude meadows. Celebrate the successful expedition with your team.

stops.title: Karzok to Leh (Drive)
stops.description: Drive back from Karzok to Leh. Enjoy the scenic journey across the Changthang plateau. Overnight in Leh.

stops.title: Departure from Leh
stops.description: Depart from Leh for your onward journey, carrying memories of your Mentok Kangri II adventure.

data.title: Mera Peak Expedition
data.description: The Mera Peak Expedition is a challenging and rewarding trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking adventurers to the summit of Mera Peak at an altitude of 21,247 ft. The trek offers stunning views of the surrounding peaks, glaciers, and valleys, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This expedition is perfect for experienced trekkers seeking a true wilderness adventure in one of the world's most spectacular mountain ranges.

stops.title: Fly from Kathmandu to Lukla, trek to Paiya
stops.description: Take an early morning flight from Kathmandu to Lukla (9,350 ft). Begin trekking through rhododendron and pine forests to Paiya (8,530 ft), a small settlement surrounded by lush hills. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Paiya to Panggom
stops.description: Trek through forests and cross several small streams. Climb over the Kari La pass and descend to Panggom (9,300 ft), a traditional Sherpa village. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Panggom to Ningsow
stops.description: Ascend and descend through rhododendron forests, passing small settlements and terraced fields. Reach Ningsow (9,800 ft), a quiet village with mountain views. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Ningsow to Chhatra Khola
stops.description: Enter the Makalu Barun National Park. Trek through bamboo and pine forests, with chances to spot red pandas. Descend to Chhatra Khola (10,170 ft). Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Chhatra Khola to Kothe
stops.description: Follow the Hinku Valley, trekking through dense forests and along the river. Reach Kothe (11,680 ft), a small settlement with teahouses. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Kothe to Thaknak
stops.description: Trek along the Hinku River, passing through yak pastures and enjoying views of Mera Peak. Arrive at Thaknak (14,270 ft), a summer grazing area. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Thaknak to Khare
stops.description: Climb gradually along the lateral moraine of the Dig Glacier to Khare (16,400 ft), the base camp for Mera Peak. Rest and acclimatize. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Training at Khare
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Khare. Practice using crampons, ice axe, and ropes. Short hikes in the area to aid acclimatization. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Khare to Mera High Camp
stops.description: Ascend steeply to Mera La (17,765 ft) and continue to Mera High Camp (19,000 ft), crossing glaciers and snowfields. Set up camp on a rocky outcrop with stunning views. Overnight in tents.

stops.title: Summit Mera Peak (21,247 ft) and return to Khare
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push. Climb gradually on snow slopes to the summit of Mera Peak (21,247 ft), the highest trekking peak in Nepal. Enjoy panoramic views of Everest, Lhotse, Makalu, and Kanchenjunga. Descend carefully to Khare for overnight rest.

stops.title: Contingency/Buffer Day
stops.description: Buffer day for summit attempt in case of bad weather or other delays. If summit was successful earlier, use this day to rest or explore Khare.

stops.title: Khare to Kothe
stops.description: Descend from Khare to Kothe, retracing your steps along the Hinku Valley. Enjoy the changing scenery and celebrate your achievement.

stops.title: Kothe to Thuli Kharka
stops.description: Climb out of the Hinku Valley to Thuli Kharka (14,270 ft), passing through rhododendron forests and alpine meadows. Overnight in a teahouse.

stops.title: Thuli Kharka to Lukla via Zatrwa La
stops.description: Cross the Zatrwa La pass (15,900 ft) and descend steeply to Lukla (9,350 ft). Celebrate the completion of your Mera Peak Expedition. Overnight in a teahouse.

data.title: Miyar Valley Trek
data.description: The Miyar Valley Trek is a hidden gem in the Indian Himalayas, taking you through the stunning Miyar Valley, known for its breathtaking landscapes and unique culture. The trek offers a chance to experience the rich biodiversity of the region and the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for adventure enthusiasts and those seeking a truly unique experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Arrive in Udaipur, drive to Shukto, trek to Khanjar
stops.description: Arrive in Udaipur (8,900 ft) in Lahaul Valley. Drive to Shukto (10,000 ft), the roadhead for the trek. Cross the Miyar River and trek through fields and small hamlets to Khanjar (11,200 ft), the last village in the valley. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Khanjar to Tharang
stops.description: Trek from Khanjar to Tharang (12,800 ft), passing through lush meadows, wildflowers, and grazing grounds. The trail offers views of snow-capped peaks and the Miyar River. Camp at Tharang.

stops.title: Tharang to Zardung
stops.description: Continue trekking through the wide Miyar Valley to Zardung (13,500 ft). The landscape becomes more alpine, with glacial streams and rocky terrain. Camp near the river.

stops.title: Zardung to Phalpu
stops.description: Trek from Zardung to Phalpu (13,900 ft), a beautiful campsite surrounded by towering peaks. The trail passes through moraine fields and offers panoramic views of the Menthosa and other peaks.

stops.title: Phalpu to Miyar Glacier snout and back
stops.description: Day hike to the snout of the Miyar Glacier (14,100 ft), the source of the Miyar River. Explore the glacier and surrounding meadows, then return to Phalpu for overnight camp.

stops.title: Phalpu to Tharang
stops.description: Retrace your steps from Phalpu to Tharang, enjoying the changing views of the valley and peaks. Camp at Tharang.

stops.title: Tharang to Khanjar, drive to Udaipur
stops.description: Descend from Tharang to Khanjar, then trek to Shukto. Board vehicles for the drive back to Udaipur. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Departure from Udaipur
stops.description: Depart from Udaipur for your onward journey, marking the end of your Miyar Valley adventure.

data.title: Mount Rinjani Trek
data.description: Mount Rinjani Trek in Indonesia is a volcanic adventure, featuring crater lakes, hot springs, and the challenging summit climb. The trek offers dramatic landscapes, unique flora and fauna, and a glimpse into the local Sasak culture.

stops.title: Sembalun to Sembalun Crater Rim (Plawangan Sembalun)
stops.description: Begin the trek from Sembalun (3,900 ft), ascending through savannah grasslands and open slopes. Reach Sembalun Crater Rim (8,600 ft) with panoramic views of Mount Rinjani and the caldera. Camp on the rim, enjoying sunset over the crater.

stops.title: Summit Attempt and Descent to Segara Anak Lake
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push to Mount Rinjani (12,224 ft). The climb is steep and challenging, with loose volcanic scree. Enjoy sunrise from the summit, then descend to Sembalun Crater Rim for breakfast. Continue down to Segara Anak Lake (6,500 ft), a turquoise crater lake. Camp by the lake and visit the hot springs.

stops.title: Segara Anak Lake to Senaru Crater Rim
stops.description: Trek around the lake and ascend steeply to Senaru Crater Rim (8,200 ft). The trail offers spectacular views of the lake, summit, and surrounding valleys. Camp on the rim, with sunset views over Lombok and the Gili Islands.

stops.title: Senaru Crater Rim to Senaru Village
stops.description: Descend through lush rainforest from Senaru Crater Rim to Senaru Village (2,000 ft). The trail passes waterfalls and offers chances to spot monkeys and tropical birds. Trek ends at Senaru, with transfer to your next destination.

data.title: Mt. Black Peak
data.description: The Mt. Black Peak Expedition is a challenging and rewarding journey in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the summit of the stunning Black Peak. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys, and a chance to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for adventure enthusiasts and those seeking a truly unique experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Dehradun to Sankri (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Sankri (6,400 ft), a scenic journey through the foothills of the Himalayas. The drive takes about 8-10 hours, passing through Mussoorie, Purola, and Mori. Overnight in a guesthouse at Sankri.

stops.title: Sankri to Taluka (Drive), trek to Seema
stops.description: Drive to Taluka (6,800 ft), then trek along the Supin River through pine forests and small villages to Seema (8,200 ft). Camp overnight.

stops.title: Seema to Rainbasera
stops.description: Trek from Seema to Rainbasera (10,200 ft), following the Supin River and passing through lush meadows and forests. Camp beside the river.

stops.title: Rainbasera to Ruinsara Tal
stops.description: Trek to Ruinsara Tal (11,800 ft), a pristine alpine lake surrounded by snow-capped peaks. The trail ascends gradually through forests and meadows. Camp by the lake.

stops.title: Ruinsara Tal to Kyarkoti
stops.description: Trek from Ruinsara Tal to Kyarkoti (12,800 ft), the base camp for Black Peak. The trail passes through boulder fields and alpine meadows. Set up base camp.

stops.title: Acclimatization and load ferry to Advance Base Camp
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Kyarkoti. Carry loads to Advance Base Camp (14,500 ft) and return. Practice technical skills and prepare for higher camps.

stops.title: Kyarkoti to Advance Base Camp
stops.description: Move to Advance Base Camp (14,500 ft), crossing moraines and glacial streams. Set up camp and rest.

stops.title: Load ferry and establish Camp 1
stops.description: Carry loads and establish Camp 1 (16,000 ft) on the glacier. Return to Advance Base Camp for overnight.

stops.title: Move to Camp 1
stops.description: Ascend to Camp 1 with remaining gear. Set up camp and rest.

stops.title: Load ferry and establish Summit Camp
stops.description: Carry loads to Summit Camp (18,000 ft), navigating crevasses and snow slopes. Return to Camp 1 for overnight.

stops.title: Move to Summit Camp
stops.description: Ascend to Summit Camp with all gear. Set up camp and rest. Final preparations for summit push.

stops.title: Rest and acclimatization at Summit Camp
stops.description: Rest day at Summit Camp. Review summit strategy, check weather, and practice technical skills. Hydrate and conserve energy.

stops.title: Summit Attempt (Black Peak, 20,955 ft)
stops.description: Pre-dawn start for the summit push. Climb steep snow and ice slopes to reach Black Peak (20,955 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Garhwal Himalayas. Descend to Summit Camp.

stops.title: Contingency day for summit
stops.description: Buffer day for summit attempt in case of bad weather or other delays. If summit is successful, begin descent to lower camps.

stops.title: Descend to Advance Base Camp
stops.description: Descend from Summit Camp to Advance Base Camp, removing higher camps and cleaning the mountain.

stops.title: Advance Base Camp to Kyarkoti to Ruinsara Tal
stops.description: Descend from Advance Base Camp to Kyarkoti and further down to Ruinsara Tal. Celebrate the successful expedition.

stops.title: Ruinsara Tal to Seema, trek to Taluka, drive to Sankri
stops.description: Trek back from Ruinsara Tal to Seema, then to Taluka. Board vehicles for the drive to Sankri. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Sankri to Dehradun (Drive)
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Dehradun, marking the end of your Mt. Black Peak Expedition.

data.title: Mt. CB 13 and CB 14 Expedition
data.description: The Mt. CB 13 and CB 14 Expedition is a challenging and rewarding journey in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the summits of the stunning CB 13 and CB 14 peaks. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys, and a chance to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for adventure enthusiasts and those seeking a truly unique experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Arrive in Manali, drive to Batal
stops.description: Arrive in Manali (6,725 ft). Meet your expedition team and drive to Batal (13,700 ft) via the scenic Rohtang Pass and Chandra Valley. The drive offers stunning views of the Pir Panjal and CB ranges. Overnight in tents at Batal.

stops.title: Batal to Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Batal to the CB Base Camp (15,100 ft), following the Chandra River and crossing glacial streams. Set up base camp with views of CB 13 and CB 14 peaks. Acclimatization and briefing.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Load Ferry
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization at Base Camp. Practice technical skills, equipment check, and ferry loads to Advance Base Camp (ABC). Short hikes for acclimatization.

stops.title: Base Camp to Advance Base Camp (ABC)
stops.description: Move to Advance Base Camp (16,400 ft) with gear and supplies. The trail crosses moraines and glacial terrain. Set up ABC and rest.

stops.title: Load Ferry and Establish Camp 1
stops.description: Carry loads and establish Camp 1 (17,700 ft) on the glacier. Return to ABC for overnight. Acclimatization and technical practice.

stops.title: Move to Camp 1
stops.description: Ascend to Camp 1 with remaining gear. Set up camp and rest. Prepare for summit attempts.

stops.title: Rest and Acclimatization at Camp 1
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization at Camp 1. Short hikes and technical training. Final summit briefing.

stops.title: Summit Attempt: CB 13 (20,551 ft)
stops.description: Pre-dawn start for the summit push to CB 13. Climb steep snow and ice slopes to the summit (20,551 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Lahaul and Spiti ranges. Descend to Camp 1.

stops.title: Rest/Contingency Day
stops.description: Buffer day for weather or additional summit attempts. Rest and recover at Camp 1 or ABC.

stops.title: Summit Attempt: CB 14 (20,300 ft)
stops.description: Early morning summit push to CB 14. The route involves glacier travel and steep snow slopes. Reach the summit (20,300 ft), then descend to Camp 1.

stops.title: Contingency/Reserve Day
stops.description: Buffer day for weather or additional summit attempts. Use for rest or descent if summits are completed.

stops.title: Descend to Advance Base Camp
stops.description: Descend from Camp 1 to Advance Base Camp, removing higher camps and cleaning the mountain.

stops.title: Advance Base Camp to Base Camp
stops.description: Descend from ABC to Base Camp, retracing your steps across the glacier and moraines.

stops.title: Base Camp to Batal
stops.description: Trek from Base Camp to Batal. Celebrate the successful expedition with your team.

stops.title: Batal to Manali (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Batal to Manali via Rohtang Pass. Arrive in Manali by evening, marking the end of your CB 13 and CB 14 Expedition.

stops.title: Departure from Manali
stops.description: Depart from Manali for your onward journey, carrying memories of your twin peak adventure.

data.title: Mt. Deo Tibba Peak
data.description: The Mt. Deo Tibba Peak Trek is a challenging and rewarding journey in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the summit of the stunning Deo Tibba peak. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys, and a chance to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for adventure enthusiasts and those seeking a truly unique experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Arrive in Manali
stops.description: Arrive in Manali (6,725 ft). Meet the expedition team, attend a briefing session, and check equipment. Overnight in hotel.

stops.title: Drive from Manali to Khanol and trek to Chikka
stops.description: Drive to Khanol (8,200 ft) and begin trekking through forests and meadows to Chikka (10,500 ft). Camp beside the river.

stops.title: Chikka to Seri
stops.description: Trek from Chikka to Seri (12,800 ft), a beautiful meadow. The trail passes through boulder fields and rhododendron thickets. Camp at Seri.

stops.title: Seri to Deo Tibba Base Camp
stops.description: Ascend from Seri to Deo Tibba Base Camp (14,698 ft), crossing moraines and streams. Set up base camp with views of Deo Tibba and Indrasan.

stops.title: Rest and acclimatization at Base Camp
stops.description: Acclimatization day at Base Camp. Short hikes to higher elevations, technical training, and equipment checks. Prepare for higher camps.

stops.title: Load ferry to Camp 1
stops.description: Carry loads and establish Camp 1 (16,400 ft) on the glacier. Return to Base Camp for overnight. This aids acclimatization.

stops.title: Move to Camp 1
stops.description: Ascend to Camp 1 with remaining gear. Set up camp on the glacier. Rest and acclimatize.

stops.title: Load ferry and establish Summit Camp
stops.description: Carry loads to Summit Camp (17,700 ft), navigating crevasses and snow slopes. Return to Camp 1 for overnight.

stops.title: Move to Summit Camp
stops.description: Ascend to Summit Camp with all gear. Set up camp and rest. Final preparations for summit push.

stops.title: Rest and acclimatization at Summit Camp
stops.description: Rest day at Summit Camp. Review summit strategy, check weather, and practice technical skills. Hydrate and conserve energy.

stops.title: Summit Attempt (Deo Tibba Peak, 19,688 ft)
stops.description: Pre-dawn start for the summit push. Climb steep snow and ice slopes to reach Deo Tibba summit (19,688 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Pir Panjal and Dhauladhar ranges. Descend to Summit Camp.

stops.title: Contingency day for summit
stops.description: Buffer day for summit attempt in case of bad weather or other delays. If summit is successful, begin descent to Base Camp.

stops.title: Descend to Base Camp and trek to Khanol, drive to Manali
stops.description: Descend from Summit Camp to Base Camp, pack up, and trek down to Khanol. Board vehicles for the drive back to Manali. Expedition ends.

data.title: Mt. Hanuman Tibba Expedition
data.description: The Mt. Hanuman Tibba Expedition is a challenging and rewarding journey that takes you to the summit of Mt. Hanuman Tibba, offering breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys. The trek takes you through beautiful forests, lush meadows, and rocky terrains. The summit offers a stunning 360-degree view of the surrounding peaks and valleys. This trek is ideal for those seeking a thrilling and scenic adventure.

stops.title: Arrive in Manali
stops.description: Arrive in Manali (6,725 ft). Meet your expedition team, attend a briefing, and check equipment. Rest and acclimatize. Overnight in a hotel.

stops.title: Manali to Solang Valley, trek to Bakarthach
stops.description: Drive from Manali to Solang Valley (8,400 ft). Begin trek through lush forests and meadows to Bakarthach (10,800 ft), a beautiful alpine campsite. Overnight in tents.

stops.title: Bakarthach to Beas Kund Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Bakarthach to Beas Kund Base Camp (12,000 ft), the staging point for Hanuman Tibba. The trail passes through boulder fields and alpine meadows. Set up camp and rest.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Training at Base Camp
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Base Camp. Practice technical skills, equipment check, and short hikes for acclimatization. Prepare for higher camps.

stops.title: Base Camp to Advance Base Camp
stops.description: Ascend to Advance Base Camp (14,000 ft), crossing moraines and glacial terrain. Set up camp and rest.

stops.title: Load ferry and establish Summit Camp
stops.description: Carry loads to Summit Camp (16,000 ft), navigating crevasses and snow slopes. Return to Advance Base Camp for overnight.

stops.title: Move to Summit Camp
stops.description: Ascend to Summit Camp with all gear. Set up camp and rest. Final preparations for summit push.

stops.title: Summit Attempt (Hanuman Tibba, 19,626 ft)
stops.description: Pre-dawn start for the summit push. Climb steep snow and ice slopes to reach Hanuman Tibba summit (19,626 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Pir Panjal and Dhauladhar ranges. Descend to Summit Camp.

stops.title: Contingency/Reserve Day
stops.description: Buffer day for summit attempt in case of bad weather or other delays. If summit is successful, begin descent to lower camps.

stops.title: Descend to Base Camp and trek to Solang, drive to Manali
stops.description: Descend from Summit Camp to Base Camp, pack up, and trek down to Solang Valley. Board vehicles for the drive back to Manali. Expedition ends.

data.title: Mt. Nun Peak
data.description: The Mt. Nun Peak Expedition is a challenging and rewarding journey in Ladakh, taking you to the summit of the stunning Nun Peak, the highest peak in the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys, and a chance to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for adventure enthusiasts and those seeking a truly unique experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Arrive in Leh (Acclimatization Day)
stops.description: Arrive in Leh (11,500 ft). Rest and acclimatize to the high altitude. Briefing with the expedition leader, equipment check, and explore Leh market. Overnight in hotel.

stops.title: Leh Acclimatization and Sightseeing
stops.description: Second day in Leh for acclimatization. Optional sightseeing to Shey Palace, Thiksey Monastery, and Hemis Monastery. Final preparations for the expedition. Overnight in Leh.

stops.title: Leh to Kargil (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Leh to Kargil (8,780 ft), a scenic journey along the Indus and Suru rivers. Pass through Lamayuru and Mulbekh. Overnight in Kargil.

stops.title: Kargil to Tangol (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Kargil to Tangol village (9,500 ft), the roadhead for the Nun expedition. Meet the local support team and prepare loads for the trek. Overnight in Tangol.

stops.title: Tangol to Base Camp (Trek)
stops.description: Begin trekking from Tangol. Cross the Suru River and ascend steeply through meadows and moraines to Nun Base Camp (15,100 ft). Set up base camp and rest.

stops.title: Rest and Acclimatization at Base Camp
stops.description: Rest, acclimatization, and technical training at Base Camp. Practice rope work, crampon use, and review safety protocols. Short acclimatization hikes.

stops.title: Load Ferry to Camp 1
stops.description: Carry loads and establish Camp 1 (17,000 ft) on the glacier. Return to Base Camp for overnight. This aids acclimatization.

stops.title: Move to Camp 1
stops.description: Ascend to Camp 1 with remaining gear. Set up camp on the glacier. Rest and acclimatize.

stops.title: Load Ferry to Camp 2
stops.description: Carry loads and establish Camp 2 (19,000 ft) on the upper glacier. Return to Camp 1 for overnight.

stops.title: Move to Camp 2
stops.description: Ascend to Camp 2 with all gear. Set up camp and rest. Prepare for higher camps.

stops.title: Rest and Acclimatization at Camp 2
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Camp 2. Short hikes and technical practice. Review summit strategy.

stops.title: Load Ferry to Summit Camp (Camp 3)
stops.description: Carry loads and establish Summit Camp (21,000 ft) on the upper slopes. Return to Camp 2 for overnight.

stops.title: Move to Summit Camp (Camp 3)
stops.description: Ascend to Summit Camp with all gear. Set up camp and rest. Final preparations for summit push.

stops.title: Rest and Acclimatization at Summit Camp
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization at Summit Camp. Review summit plan, check weather, and hydrate well.

stops.title: Summit Attempt (Mt. Nun, 23,409 ft)
stops.description: Pre-dawn start for the summit push. Climb steep snow and ice slopes to reach the summit of Mt. Nun (23,409 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Zanskar and Karakoram ranges. Descend to Summit Camp.

stops.title: Contingency/Reserve Day
stops.description: Buffer day for summit attempt in case of bad weather or other delays. If summit is successful, begin descent to lower camps.

stops.title: Descend to Camp 2
stops.description: Descend from Summit Camp to Camp 2, removing higher camps and cleaning the mountain.

stops.title: Descend to Camp 1
stops.description: Descend from Camp 2 to Camp 1, retracing your steps across the glacier.

stops.title: Descend to Base Camp
stops.description: Descend from Camp 1 to Base Camp, celebrating the successful expedition.

stops.title: Base Camp to Tangol (Trek)
stops.description: Trek down from Base Camp to Tangol village. Enjoy the return to green meadows and lower altitudes. Overnight in Tangol.

stops.title: Tangol to Kargil (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Tangol to Kargil. Rest and celebrate with the team. Overnight in Kargil.

stops.title: Kargil to Leh (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Kargil to Leh, retracing your route along the Indus valley. Overnight in Leh.

stops.title: Departure from Leh
stops.description: Depart from Leh for your onward journey, carrying memories of your Mt. Nun adventure.

data.title: Nafran Valley Trek
data.description: The Nafran Valley Trek is a captivating journey that offers stunning views of the Himalayan peaks and the beautiful valleys of Jammu and Kashmir. The trek takes you through lush green meadows, dense forests, and charming villages. The valley is also home to a diverse range of flora and fauna, including the elusive snow leopard. This trek is ideal for those seeking a unique and breathtaking natural experience.

stops.title: Srinagar to Aru (Pahalgam)
stops.description: Arrive in Srinagar (5,200 ft) and drive to Aru village (7,950 ft), the base for the Nafran Valley Trek. The scenic drive takes you through Anantnag and Pahalgam, following the Lidder River. Explore Aru village and acclimatize. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp.

stops.title: Aru to Lidderwat
stops.description: Begin trekking from Aru to Lidderwat (9,150 ft). The trail passes through pine forests, lush meadows, and alongside the Lidder River. Enjoy views of the surrounding mountains and spot local shepherds with their flocks. Camp at Lidderwat.

stops.title: Lidderwat to Satlanjan
stops.description: Trek from Lidderwat to Satlanjan (10,500 ft), a beautiful meadow surrounded by snow-capped peaks. The trail ascends gradually through birch forests and alpine pastures. Camp at Satlanjan.

stops.title: Satlanjan to Nafran Valley Base Camp
stops.description: Ascend from Satlanjan to Nafran Valley Base Camp (11,270 ft). The trail climbs steadily, crossing streams and boulder fields, and opens up to the breathtaking Nafran Valley. Set up camp amidst wildflowers and panoramic mountain views.

stops.title: Explore Nafran Valley (Optional: Harnag Lake)
stops.description: Spend the day exploring the pristine Nafran Valley. Optional hike to Harnag Lake (12,500 ft), a glacial lake surrounded by dramatic peaks. Spot rare Himalayan flora and, with luck, wildlife such as marmots or the elusive snow leopard. Return to base camp.

stops.title: Nafran Valley Base Camp to Lidderwat
stops.description: Retrace your steps from Nafran Valley Base Camp to Lidderwat. The descent offers new perspectives of the valley and meadows. Camp at Lidderwat.

stops.title: Lidderwat to Aru, drive to Srinagar
stops.description: Trek back from Lidderwat to Aru, passing through forests and meadows. Board vehicles for the drive to Srinagar, marking the end of your Nafran Valley adventure.

data.title: Nag Tibba Trek
data.description: The Nag Tibba Trek is a short and scenic trek that takes you to the Nag Tibba, the highest peak in the Nag Tibba range, offering stunning views of the surrounding peaks and valleys. The trek takes you through beautiful forests, lush meadows, and rocky terrains. This trek is ideal for those looking for a quick escape into the mountains.

stops.title: Dehradun to Pantwari, trek to Nag Tibba Base Camp
stops.description: Drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Pantwari village (4,640 ft), the starting point of the trek (approx. 4-5 hours). Begin trekking from Pantwari through terraced fields and oak forests to Nag Tibba Base Camp (7,600 ft). Enjoy sunset views of the Garhwal Himalayas. Overnight in tents.

stops.title: Nag Tibba Base Camp to Nag Tibba Summit and return to Pantwari, drive to Dehradun
stops.description: Early morning trek to Nag Tibba summit (9,915 ft), the highest peak in the Nag Tibba range. Enjoy panoramic views of Bandarpoonch, Swargarohini, and Kedarnath peaks. Descend back to base camp, then to Pantwari. Drive back to Dehradun, marking the end of your trek.

data.title: Nanda Devi Base Camp
data.description: The Nanda Devi Base Camp Trek is a classic Himalayan trek that takes you to the base camp of Nanda Devi, the second highest peak in India. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and glaciers. Trekkers will enjoy walking through ancient monasteries, charming villages, and pristine landscapes. This trek is ideal for those looking to experience the raw beauty of the Himalayas.

stops.title: Kathgodam to Munsiyari (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Kathgodam (1,800 ft) to Munsiyari (7,200 ft), a journey of 10-12 hours through the Kumaon hills. Pass through Almora, Bageshwar, and picturesque villages. Munsiyari is a beautiful hill town with views of the Panchachuli peaks. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Munsiyari to Lilam (Drive + Trek)
stops.description: Drive from Munsiyari to roadhead at Selapani, then trek to Lilam (5,700 ft). The trail descends through forests and small villages, following the Gori Ganga river. Camp at Lilam.

stops.title: Lilam to Bugdiar
stops.description: Trek from Lilam to Bugdiar (8,200 ft), following the Gori Ganga valley. The trail passes through dense forests, waterfalls, and suspension bridges. Camp at Bugdiar.

stops.title: Bugdiar to Rilkot
stops.description: Trek from Bugdiar to Rilkot (10,200 ft). The trail climbs steadily, passing through forests and meadows, with views of the surrounding peaks. Camp at Rilkot.

stops.title: Rilkot to Martoli
stops.description: Trek from Rilkot to Martoli (11,200 ft), a historic village with ancient stone houses. The trail offers panoramic views of Nanda Devi East and Hardeol peaks. Explore the village and camp overnight.

stops.title: Martoli to Milam
stops.description: Trek from Martoli to Milam (11,500 ft), the last major village before the base camp. The trail passes through meadows and small settlements, with views of the Milam glacier. Camp at Milam.

stops.title: Milam to Nanda Devi Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Milam to Nanda Devi Base Camp (12,795 ft), the highlight of the trek. The trail ascends through alpine meadows and moraines, offering spectacular views of Nanda Devi East and surrounding peaks. Camp at the base camp.

stops.title: Explore Nanda Devi Base Camp
stops.description: Spend the day exploring the base camp area. Take short hikes to nearby ridges for better views of Nanda Devi and the glaciers. Enjoy the pristine alpine environment and return to the same campsite.

stops.title: Nanda Devi Base Camp to Milam
stops.description: Retrace your steps from base camp to Milam. The descent offers new perspectives of the valley and surrounding peaks. Camp at Milam.

stops.title: Milam to Bugdiar
stops.description: Descend from Milam to Bugdiar, passing through Martoli and Rilkot. Enjoy the changing scenery as you lose altitude. Camp at Bugdiar.

stops.title: Bugdiar to Lilam
stops.description: Continue descending from Bugdiar to Lilam, retracing your steps along the Gori Ganga river. Camp at Lilam.

stops.title: Lilam to Munsiyari (Trek + Drive)
stops.description: Trek from Lilam to the roadhead, then drive back to Munsiyari. Celebrate the completion of your trek and enjoy the comforts of the hill town.

data.title: Pangarchulla Peak Trek
data.description: The Pangarchulla Peak Trek is a stunning and moderately challenging trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the summit of Pangarchulla Peak at an altitude of 15,100 ft. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks, valleys, and glaciers, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for those seeking a blend of adventure, natural beauty, and cultural immersion.

stops.title: Rishikesh/Haridwar to Joshimath (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Rishikesh/Haridwar (1,030 ft) to Joshimath (6,725 ft), gateway to the Garhwal Himalayas. The 8-10 hour journey passes through Devprayag, Rudraprayag, and Chamoli, following the Alaknanda River. Overnight in a guesthouse or hotel at Joshimath.

stops.title: Joshimath to Dhak, trek to Gulling
stops.description: Drive from Joshimath to Dhak (6,890 ft), the trek starting point. Trek through mountain villages and terraced fields, gradually ascending to Gulling (9,200 ft). Enjoy views of Dronagiri and Hathi Parvat. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Gulling to Khullara
stops.description: Trek from Gulling to Khullara (11,100 ft), passing through oak, rhododendron, and conifer forests. The trail offers glimpses of Nanda Devi and other peaks. Camp at Khullara, a beautiful clearing in the forest.

stops.title: Khullara to Pangarchulla Base Camp
stops.description: Ascend from Khullara to Pangarchulla Base Camp (12,000 ft). The trail traverses alpine meadows with grand views of Nanda Devi, Kamet, and Dronagiri. Prepare for the summit attempt. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Summit Pangarchulla Peak (15,100 ft) and return to Base Camp
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push. Climb steep snow and rocky slopes to reach Pangarchulla Peak (15,100 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Garhwal Himalayas, including Nanda Devi, Chaukhamba, and Hathi Parvat. Descend carefully back to Base Camp.

stops.title: Base Camp to Gulling, trek to Dhak, drive to Joshimath
stops.description: Descend from Base Camp to Gulling and further down to Dhak. Board vehicles for the drive back to Joshimath. Celebrate the successful summit with your team.

stops.title: Joshimath to Rishikesh/Haridwar (Drive)
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Rishikesh/Haridwar, marking the end of your Pangarchulla Peak adventure. Arrive by evening.

data.title: Panwali Kantha Trek
data.description: The Panwali Kantha Trek is a beautiful and moderately challenging trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking you through the stunning Panwali Kantha meadows and offering breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys. The trek also takes you through dense forests of oak and rhododendron, and past traditional villages and terraced fields. Trekkers will have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people, and to enjoy the vibrant flora and fauna of the region. This trek is perfect for those seeking a blend of adventure, natural beauty, and cultural immersion.

stops.title: Rishikesh to Ghuttu (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Rishikesh (1,030 ft) to Ghuttu (5,250 ft), the base village for the Panwali Kantha Trek. The journey takes you through the Tehri region, with views of the Bhagirathi River and terraced fields. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp at Ghuttu.

stops.title: Ghuttu to Gaurmanda
stops.description: Begin trekking from Ghuttu to Gaurmanda (7,800 ft). The trail ascends gradually through pine and oak forests, passing small villages and meadows. Camp at Gaurmanda with views of the surrounding hills.

stops.title: Gaurmanda to Panwali Kantha Meadows
stops.description: Trek from Gaurmanda to the beautiful Panwali Kantha meadows (10,800 ft). The trail climbs through rhododendron forests and opens up to vast alpine grasslands with panoramic views of the Garhwal Himalayas, including Nanda Devi, Trishul, and Chaukhamba. Camp amidst the meadows.

stops.title: Explore Panwali Kantha, trek to Maggu Chatti
stops.description: Spend the morning exploring the Panwali Kantha meadows, enjoying sunrise and the sweeping mountain views. Later, trek down to Maggu Chatti (8,200 ft), passing through forests and small clearings. Camp at Maggu Chatti.

stops.title: Maggu Chatti to Ghuttu, drive to Rishikesh
stops.description: Descend from Maggu Chatti to Ghuttu, retracing your steps through forests and villages. Board vehicles for the drive back to Rishikesh, marking the end of your Panwali Kantha adventure.

data.title: Parang La Expedition
data.description: The Parang La Expedition is a challenging and rewarding journey in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the stunning Parang La, a high mountain pass that offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys. The trek involves crossing high mountain passes, walking on glaciers, and navigating through rugged terrains. Trekkers will be rewarded with a sense of accomplishment in crossing one of the less-traveled paths in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Arrive in Kaza (Acclimatization Day)
stops.description: Arrive in Kaza (12,000 ft), the administrative center of Spiti Valley. Spend the day acclimatizing, exploring the local market, and visiting nearby monasteries such as Key and Kibber. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Kaza to Kibber (Drive), trek to Dumla
stops.description: Drive from Kaza to Kibber (14,100 ft), one of the highest inhabited villages in the world. Begin trekking from Kibber to Dumla (14,400 ft), a short but important acclimatization walk. Camp at Dumla.

stops.title: Dumla to Thaltak Meadow
stops.description: Trek from Dumla to Thaltak Meadow (15,700 ft). The trail ascends steeply, offering panoramic views of the Spiti Valley. Camp at Thaltak, a beautiful high-altitude meadow.

stops.title: Thaltak to Bongrojen
stops.description: Descend to the Parilungbi gorge and cross the river. Then ascend to Bongrojen (17,000 ft), the base camp for Parang La. The day involves steep climbs and river crossings. Camp at Bongrojen.

stops.title: Bongrojen to Parang La (18,307 ft), descend to Karsha Gongma
stops.description: Early morning ascent to Parang La (18,307 ft), the highest point of the trek. Enjoy breathtaking views of the Ladakh and Spiti ranges. Descend to Karsha Gongma (15,700 ft) and camp by the Pare Chu river.

stops.title: Karsha Gongma to Datang Yongma
stops.description: Trek along the Pare Chu river, crossing several streams and walking on riverbeds. Reach Datang Yongma (14,800 ft), a wide grazing ground. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Datang Yongma to Chumik Shilde
stops.description: Continue trekking along the river, passing through vast meadows and occasional shepherd camps. Reach Chumik Shilde (15,100 ft), a beautiful campsite with views of the Changthang plateau.

stops.title: Chumik Shilde to Kiangdom (Tso Moriri)
stops.description: Trek to Kiangdom (15,200 ft), located at the southern edge of Tso Moriri Lake. The trail offers the first glimpses of the turquoise lake and herds of wild kiang (Tibetan wild ass). Camp by the lake.

stops.title: Kiangdom to Korzok (Tso Moriri)
stops.description: Walk along the western shore of Tso Moriri Lake to reach Korzok (15,000 ft), the only village on the lake's banks. Visit the ancient Korzok Monastery and explore the lakeside. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp.

stops.title: Buffer/Exploration Day at Tso Moriri
stops.description: Buffer day for weather or to explore the Tso Moriri region. Optional hikes to nearby hills for panoramic views or visit nomadic Changpa settlements.

stops.title: Drive from Korzok to Leh
stops.description: Board vehicles for the long and scenic drive from Korzok to Leh (11,500 ft), passing through the Changthang plateau and crossing Namshang La and Mahe Bridge. Arrive in Leh by evening.

stops.title: Departure from Leh
stops.description: Depart from Leh for your onward journey, carrying memories of your Parang La adventure.

data.title: Phulara Ridge Trek
data.description: The Phulara Ridge Trek is a captivating journey that offers stunning views of the Himalayan peaks and the beautiful valleys of Uttarakhand. The trek takes you through lush green meadows, dense forests, and charming villages. The ridge itself offers a breathtaking 180-degree view of the surrounding peaks and valleys. This trek is perfect for those seeking a scenic and peaceful trekking experience.

stops.title: Dehradun to Sankri (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Sankri (6,400 ft), a picturesque village in Uttarkashi district. The 8-10 hour drive passes through Mussoorie, Purola, and Mori, following the Tons River. Sankri serves as the base for several treks in the region. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Sankri to Juda Ka Talab
stops.description: Trek from Sankri to Juda Ka Talab (9,000 ft), a beautiful high-altitude lake surrounded by pine forests. The trail ascends gradually through dense woods and opens up to a serene campsite by the lake. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Juda Ka Talab to Bhoj Gadi
stops.description: Trek from Juda Ka Talab to Bhoj Gadi (10,800 ft). The trail climbs steadily through oak and rhododendron forests, opening up to alpine meadows with views of snow-capped peaks. Camp at Bhoj Gadi.

stops.title: Bhoj Gadi to Phulara Ridge to Pushtara
stops.description: Ascend from Bhoj Gadi to the spectacular Phulara Ridge (12,250 ft), walking along the ridge with 180-degree Himalayan views. Continue to Pushtara (9,500 ft), a vast meadow with wildflowers in season. Camp at Pushtara.

stops.title: Pushtara to Taluka, drive to Sankri
stops.description: Descend from Pushtara through forests and meadows to Taluka (6,800 ft). Board vehicles for the short drive back to Sankri. Celebrate the completion of your trek.

stops.title: Sankri to Dehradun (Drive)
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Dehradun, marking the end of your Phulara Ridge adventure. Arrive in Dehradun by evening.

data.title: Pin Bhaba Pass Trek
data.description: The Pin Bhaba Pass Trek is a challenging yet rewarding journey that takes you over the Pin Bhaba Pass, offering breathtaking views of the Himalayan ranges. The trek takes you through beautiful forests, lush meadows, and rocky terrains. The pass itself offers a stunning 360-degree view of the surrounding peaks and valleys. This trek is ideal for those seeking a thrilling and scenic adventure.

stops.title: Shimla to Kafnu (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Shimla (7,200 ft) to Kafnu (7,900 ft), the starting point of the trek. The journey takes you through the beautiful Kinnaur Valley, passing through Rampur and Wangtu. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp at Kafnu.

stops.title: Kafnu to Mulling
stops.description: Trek from Kafnu to Mulling (10,800 ft). The trail passes through forests, meadows, and along the Bhaba River. Cross several wooden bridges and enjoy views of waterfalls and snow-capped peaks. Camp at Mulling.

stops.title: Mulling to Kara
stops.description: Trek from Mulling to Kara (11,700 ft), a beautiful meadow surrounded by mountains. The trail ascends gradually, passing through alpine pastures and crossing streams. Camp at Kara.

stops.title: Kara to Phustirang
stops.description: Trek from Kara to Phustirang (13,500 ft), the base camp for the Pin Bhaba Pass. The trail climbs steadily, offering views of the Bhaba Valley and surrounding peaks. Camp at Phustirang.

stops.title: Acclimatization/Rest Day at Phustirang
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Phustirang. Take short hikes to higher elevations to aid acclimatization and prepare for the pass crossing. Enjoy the panoramic views and relax at camp.

stops.title: Phustirang to Pin Bhaba Pass (16,098 ft) to Mangrungse
stops.description: The most challenging day. Early morning ascent to Pin Bhaba Pass (16,098 ft), the highest point of the trek, with breathtaking views of the Pin and Bhaba valleys. Descend steeply into the Spiti side to Mangrungse (13,300 ft). Camp at Mangrungse.

stops.title: Mangrungse to Mudh
stops.description: Trek from Mangrungse to Mudh (12,300 ft), the first village in Spiti Valley. The trail descends gradually, passing through stark Spiti landscapes and colorful mountains. Celebrate the completion of your trek in Mudh.

stops.title: Mudh to Kaza (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Mudh to Kaza (12,000 ft), the administrative center of Spiti Valley. Explore Kaza, visit local monasteries, and relax after your trek. Trek ends.

data.title: Pin Parvati Pass Expedition
data.description: The Pin Parvati Pass Expedition is a challenging and rewarding journey in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the stunning Pin Parvati Pass. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys, and a chance to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for adventure enthusiasts and those seeking a truly unique experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Manali to Barshaini (Drive), trek to Kalga
stops.description: Drive from Manali (6,725 ft) to Barshaini (7,900 ft), the starting point of the trek. Trek a short distance to Kalga (8,500 ft), a quaint village surrounded by apple orchards. Overnight in guesthouse or camp.

stops.title: Kalga to Kheerganga
stops.description: Trek from Kalga to Kheerganga (9,700 ft), famous for its hot springs. The trail passes through dense forests, waterfalls, and small hamlets. Camp at Kheerganga.

stops.title: Kheerganga to Tunda Bhuj
stops.description: Trek from Kheerganga to Tunda Bhuj (10,500 ft). The trail ascends through pine forests, meadows, and several stream crossings. Camp at Tunda Bhuj.

stops.title: Tunda Bhuj to Thakur Kuan
stops.description: Trek from Tunda Bhuj to Thakur Kuan (11,800 ft), crossing several wooden bridges and boulder fields. The landscape becomes more alpine. Camp at Thakur Kuan.

stops.title: Thakur Kuan to Odi Thach
stops.description: Trek from Thakur Kuan to Odi Thach (12,500 ft), a beautiful meadow with views of snow-capped peaks. Cross the Parvati River on a natural rock bridge. Camp at Odi Thach.

stops.title: Odi Thach to Mantalai Lake
stops.description: Trek from Odi Thach to Mantalai Lake (13,500 ft), the source of the Parvati River. The trail passes through moraines and glacial streams. Camp near the sacred lake.

stops.title: Mantalai Lake to Base Camp
stops.description: Ascend from Mantalai Lake to the Pin Parvati Base Camp (15,000 ft). The trail is steep and crosses rocky terrain and glacial moraines. Camp at Base Camp.

stops.title: Base Camp to Pin Parvati Pass (17,382 ft) to Pin Base
stops.description: The most challenging day. Early morning ascent to Pin Parvati Pass (17,382 ft), the highest point of the trek, with breathtaking views of the Parvati and Pin valleys. Descend steeply into Spiti to Pin Base (15,000 ft). Camp at Pin Base.

stops.title: Pin Base to Tiya
stops.description: Trek from Pin Base to Tiya (13,500 ft), descending through the stark and colorful landscapes of Spiti. Camp at Tiya.

stops.title: Tiya to Mudh
stops.description: Trek from Tiya to Mudh (12,400 ft), the first village in Spiti Valley. The trail descends gradually, passing through high-altitude meadows and crossing streams. Celebrate the completion of your trek in Mudh.

stops.title: Mudh to Kaza (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Mudh to Kaza (12,000 ft), the administrative center of Spiti Valley. Explore Kaza, visit local monasteries, and relax after your trek.

stops.title: Kaza to Manali (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Kaza to Manali, crossing the Kunzum La and Rohtang Pass. Arrive in Manali by evening, marking the end of your Pin Parvati Pass adventure.

data.title: Pindari Glacier Trek
data.description: The Pindari Glacier Trek is a classic Himalayan trek that takes you to the Pindari Glacier, one of the most accessible glaciers in the Indian Himalayas. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and glaciers. Trekkers will enjoy walking through lush green meadows, dense forests, and rocky terrains. This trek is ideal for those looking to experience the raw beauty of the Himalayas.

stops.title: Kathgodam to Loharkhet (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Kathgodam (1,800 ft) to Loharkhet (5,900 ft), the starting point of the trek. The journey passes through Almora, Bageshwar, and picturesque Kumaon villages. Overnight in a guesthouse at Loharkhet.

stops.title: Loharkhet to Dhakuri
stops.description: Trek from Loharkhet to Dhakuri (8,900 ft). The trail ascends through dense forests and offers beautiful views of the valley. Dhakuri is a scenic meadow with panoramic Himalayan views. Camp or stay in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Dhakuri to Khati
stops.description: Trek from Dhakuri to Khati (7,450 ft), the largest village on the route. The trail descends through forests and crosses several streams. Experience Kumaoni hospitality in Khati.

stops.title: Khati to Dwali
stops.description: Trek from Khati to Dwali (8,700 ft), following the Pindar River through thick forests and along waterfalls. Dwali is a small settlement at the confluence of the Pindar and Kafni rivers.

stops.title: Dwali to Phurkia
stops.description: Trek from Dwali to Phurkia (10,500 ft), a beautiful campsite surrounded by high mountains. The trail ascends steadily, passing through rhododendron forests and alpine meadows.

stops.title: Phurkia to Pindari Glacier and back to Dwali
stops.description: Early morning trek to Pindari Glacier Zero Point (12,300 ft), the highlight of the trek. Enjoy breathtaking views of the glacier and surrounding peaks. After spending time at the glacier, return to Dwali for overnight stay.

stops.title: Dwali to Khati
stops.description: Retrace your steps from Dwali to Khati, enjoying the descent and the changing scenery. Overnight in Khati.

stops.title: Khati to Dhakuri
stops.description: Trek from Khati to Dhakuri, ascending back through forests and meadows. Celebrate the completion of your trek with your team.

stops.title: Dhakuri to Loharkhet, drive to Kathgodam
stops.description: Descend from Dhakuri to Loharkhet. Board vehicles for the drive back to Kathgodam, marking the end of your Pindari Glacier adventure.

data.title: Pir Ki Gali / Girjan Valley Trek
data.description: The Pir Ki Gali / Girjan Valley Trek is a beautiful and moderately challenging trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking you through the stunning Girjan Valley and offering breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys. The trek also takes you through dense forests of oak and rhododendron, and past traditional villages and terraced fields. Trekkers will have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people, and to enjoy the vibrant flora and fauna of the region. This trek is perfect for those seeking a blend of adventure, natural beauty, and cultural immersion.

stops.title: Srinagar to Shopian (Drive)
stops.description: Arrive in Srinagar (5,200 ft) and drive to Shopian (7,000 ft), the gateway to the Pir Panjal range. The scenic drive passes through apple orchards and rolling hills. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp at Shopian.

stops.title: Shopian to Pir Ki Gali
stops.description: Drive or trek from Shopian to Pir Ki Gali (11,450 ft), the highest point on the Mughal Road. The route offers panoramic views of the Pir Panjal range and lush meadows. Acclimatize and explore the area. Camp near Pir Ki Gali.

stops.title: Pir Ki Gali to Girjan Valley
stops.description: Trek from Pir Ki Gali to Girjan Valley (10,000 ft), descending through alpine meadows, pine forests, and traditional Gujjar settlements. The valley is known for its wildflowers and tranquil streams. Camp in the valley.

stops.title: Explore Girjan Valley
stops.description: Spend the day exploring Girjan Valley. Take short hikes to nearby ridges for views of the Pir Panjal peaks, visit local villages, and enjoy the vibrant flora and fauna. Return to the same campsite.

stops.title: Girjan Valley to Noori Chamb
stops.description: Trek from Girjan Valley to Noori Chamb (8,500 ft), a famous waterfall named after Mughal queen Noor Jahan. The trail passes through dense forests and open meadows. Camp near the waterfall.

stops.title: Noori Chamb to Poonch (Drive)
stops.description: Descend to the roadhead and drive to Poonch (3,300 ft), a historic town near the Line of Control. Celebrate the completion of your trek and explore the local market. Trek ends.

data.title: Pir Panjal Lakes Trek
data.description: The Pir Panjal Lakes Trek is a captivating journey that offers stunning views of the Himalayan peaks and the beautiful valleys of Jammu and Kashmir. The trek takes you through lush green meadows, dense forests, and rocky terrains. The lakes are a sight to behold, with their crystal-clear waters reflecting the surrounding mountains. This trek is ideal for those looking to experience the raw beauty of the Himalayas.

stops.title: Srinagar to Doodhpathri (Drive)
stops.description: Arrive in Srinagar (5,200 ft) and drive to Doodhpathri (8,900 ft), a scenic meadow known for its rolling grasslands and pine forests. Acclimatize and explore the area. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp.

stops.title: Doodhpathri to Diskhal Meadow
stops.description: Begin trekking from Doodhpathri to Diskhal Meadow (10,500 ft). The trail ascends through pine and fir forests, opening up to lush meadows with views of the Pir Panjal range. Camp at Diskhal.

stops.title: Diskhal Meadow to Damamsar Lake
stops.description: Trek from Diskhal Meadow to Damamsar Lake (12,000 ft), the first of the Pir Panjal lakes. The trail passes through alpine meadows and boulder fields. Camp near the lake, surrounded by snow-capped peaks.

stops.title: Damamsar Lake to Gadtar Lake
stops.description: Trek from Damamsar Lake to Gadtar Lake (13,335 ft), the highest point of the trek. The route traverses high ridges and offers panoramic views of the Pir Panjal and Kashmir valleys. Camp near the pristine Gadtar Lake.

stops.title: Gadtar Lake to Ashtaar Valley
stops.description: Descend from Gadtar Lake to Ashtaar Valley (11,000 ft), passing through wildflower meadows and grazing grounds. The valley is known for its tranquility and scenic beauty. Camp in Ashtaar Valley.

stops.title: Ashtaar Valley to Yusmarg
stops.description: Trek from Ashtaar Valley to Yusmarg (7,900 ft), a famous meadow destination in Kashmir. The trail descends through pine forests and open grasslands. Celebrate the completion of your trek in Yusmarg.

stops.title: Yusmarg to Srinagar (Drive)
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Srinagar. The journey passes through rural Kashmir, offering a glimpse into local life. Arrive in Srinagar by afternoon, marking the end of your Pir Panjal Lakes adventure.

data.title: Ranthan Kharak Trek
data.description: Ranthan Kharak Trek in Kumaon is a scenic journey through oak and rhododendron forests, alpine meadows, and remote villages. The trail offers grand views of the Kumaon Himalayas and is perfect for those seeking offbeat trekking experiences.

stops.title: Kathgodam to Munsiyari (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Kathgodam (1,800 ft) to Munsiyari (7,200 ft), passing through Almora, Bageshwar, and picturesque Kumaon villages. Munsiyari is a beautiful hill town with views of the Panchachuli peaks. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Munsiyari to Lilam (Drive + Trek)
stops.description: Drive from Munsiyari to the roadhead at Selapani, then trek to Lilam (5,700 ft). The trail descends through forests and small villages, following the Gori Ganga river. Camp at Lilam.

stops.title: Lilam to Bugdiar
stops.description: Trek from Lilam to Bugdiar (8,200 ft), following the Gori Ganga valley. The trail passes through dense forests, waterfalls, and suspension bridges. Camp at Bugdiar.

stops.title: Bugdiar to Ranthan Kharak
stops.description: Trek from Bugdiar to Ranthan Kharak (12,887 ft), a beautiful high-altitude meadow with panoramic views of the Kumaon Himalayas. The trail climbs steadily through forests and alpine pastures. Camp at Ranthan Kharak.

stops.title: Explore Ranthan Kharak
stops.description: Spend the day exploring the meadows and ridges of Ranthan Kharak. Enjoy sunrise and sunset views of the surrounding peaks, and take short hikes to nearby vantage points. Return to the same campsite.

stops.title: Ranthan Kharak to Bugdiar
stops.description: Descend from Ranthan Kharak to Bugdiar, retracing your steps through alpine meadows and forests. Camp at Bugdiar.

stops.title: Bugdiar to Lilam, trek to roadhead, drive to Munsiyari
stops.description: Trek from Bugdiar to Lilam, then to the roadhead. Board vehicles for the drive back to Munsiyari. Celebrate the completion of your trek.

data.title: Roopkund Trek
data.description: The Roopkund Trek, also known as the 'Mystery Lake Trek', is a stunning and moderately challenging trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the famous Roopkund Lake, known for the human skeletons found at its shore. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks, valleys, and glaciers, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for those seeking a blend of adventure, natural beauty, and cultural immersion.

stops.title: Kathgodam to Lohajung (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Kathgodam (1,800 ft) to Lohajung (7,700 ft), the base for the Roopkund Trek. The journey passes through Almora, Kausani, and beautiful Kumaon villages. Overnight in a guesthouse at Lohajung.

stops.title: Lohajung to Didna
stops.description: Trek from Lohajung to Didna village (8,200 ft). The trail descends to the Bedni Ganga river and then ascends through forests and terraced fields. Experience local village life. Camp or stay in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Didna to Ali Bugyal
stops.description: Trek from Didna to Ali Bugyal (11,200 ft), one of the most beautiful meadows in Uttarakhand. The trail climbs steeply through oak and rhododendron forests before opening up to vast alpine grasslands. Camp at Ali Bugyal.

stops.title: Ali Bugyal to Bedni Bugyal
stops.description: Trek from Ali Bugyal to Bedni Bugyal (11,500 ft), traversing rolling meadows with panoramic views of Trishul and Nanda Ghunti peaks. Explore the Bedni Kund and enjoy the high-altitude scenery. Camp at Bedni Bugyal.

stops.title: Bedni Bugyal to Patar Nachauni
stops.description: Trek from Bedni Bugyal to Patar Nachauni (12,700 ft). The trail ascends gradually, passing through alpine meadows and offering views of the surrounding peaks. Camp at Patar Nachauni.

stops.title: Patar Nachauni to Bhagwabasa via Kalu Vinayak
stops.description: Ascend from Patar Nachauni to Bhagwabasa (14,100 ft) via the steep climb to Kalu Vinayak temple (14,500 ft). The trail offers dramatic mountain views and rocky terrain. Camp at Bhagwabasa.

stops.title: Bhagwabasa to Roopkund and back to Bedni Bugyal
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push to Roopkund Lake (15,696 ft), the famous 'Mystery Lake' with its ancient skeletons. Enjoy the breathtaking views and, if weather permits, climb further to Junargali Pass (16,000 ft). Descend back to Bedni Bugyal for overnight camp.

stops.title: Bedni Bugyal to Lohajung
stops.description: Descend from Bedni Bugyal to Lohajung, retracing your steps through meadows and forests. Celebrate the completion of your trek in Lohajung.

stops.title: Lohajung to Kathgodam (Drive)
stops.description: After breakfast, drive back to Kathgodam, marking the end of your Roopkund adventure. Arrive in Kathgodam by evening.

data.title: Rudragaira Peak Expedition
data.description: The Rudragaira Peak Expedition is a challenging and rewarding trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking adventurers to the summit of Rudragaira Peak at an altitude of 19,086 ft. The trek offers stunning views of the surrounding peaks, glaciers, and valleys, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This expedition is perfect for experienced trekkers seeking a true wilderness adventure in one of the world's most spectacular mountain ranges.

stops.title: Dehradun to Gangotri (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Gangotri (10,000 ft), the spiritual source of the Ganges. The 10-12 hour journey passes through Uttarkashi and follows the Bhagirathi River. Overnight in a guesthouse at Gangotri.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Exploration in Gangotri
stops.description: Spend the day acclimatizing in Gangotri. Visit the famous Gangotri Temple, explore the local market, and take a short acclimatization hike to nearby viewpoints. Attend trek briefing and equipment check in the evening.

stops.title: Gangotri to Bhojbasa
stops.description: Trek from Gangotri to Bhojbasa (12,400 ft), following the Bhagirathi River through pine forests and along a well-defined trail. Enjoy views of the Bhagirathi peaks. Bhojbasa is a beautiful campsite surrounded by silver birch trees.

stops.title: Bhojbasa to Nandanvan
stops.description: Trek from Bhojbasa to Nandanvan (14,600 ft), crossing the Gangotri Glacier. The trail offers stunning views of Shivling, Bhagirathi, and Meru peaks. Nandanvan is a high-altitude meadow and serves as a base for several expeditions.

stops.title: Nandanvan to Rudragaira Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Nandanvan to Rudragaira Base Camp (14,800 ft), traversing moraines and rocky terrain. Set up camp with views of Rudragaira, Gangotri, and Auden's Col.

stops.title: Rest and Acclimatization at Base Camp
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Rudragaira Base Camp. Practice technical skills, equipment check, and short hikes to higher elevations. Prepare for higher camps.

stops.title: Load Ferry to Advance Base Camp
stops.description: Carry loads and establish Advance Base Camp (16,400 ft) on the glacier. Return to Base Camp for overnight. This aids acclimatization.

stops.title: Move to Advance Base Camp
stops.description: Ascend to Advance Base Camp (16,400 ft) with remaining gear. Set up camp and rest.

stops.title: Load Ferry and Establish Summit Camp
stops.description: Carry loads to Summit Camp (17,800 ft), navigating crevasses and snow slopes. Return to Advance Base Camp for overnight.

stops.title: Move to Summit Camp
stops.description: Ascend to Summit Camp (17,800 ft) with all gear. Set up camp and rest. Final preparations for summit push.

stops.title: Summit Attempt (Rudragaira Peak, 19,086 ft)
stops.description: Pre-dawn start for the summit push. Climb steep snow and ice slopes to reach Rudragaira Peak (19,086 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Gangotri group, Shivling, and surrounding peaks. Descend to Summit Camp.

stops.title: Contingency/Reserve Day
stops.description: Buffer day for summit attempt in case of bad weather or other delays. If summit is successful, begin descent to lower camps.

stops.title: Descend to Base Camp
stops.description: Descend from Summit Camp to Advance Base Camp and further down to Base Camp. Celebrate the successful expedition.

stops.title: Base Camp to Gangotri, drive to Dehradun
stops.description: Trek from Base Camp to Gangotri, retracing your steps. Board vehicles for the drive back to Dehradun, marking the end of your Rudragaira Peak adventure.

data.title: Rumtse to Tso Moriri Lake Trek
data.description: The Rumtse to Tso Moriri Lake Trek is a spectacular journey in Ladakh, taking you from the stunning Rumtse village to the beautiful Tso Moriri Lake, known for its pristine beauty and tranquility. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys, and a chance to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for adventure enthusiasts and those seeking a truly unique experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Leh to Rumtse (Drive)
stops.description: Arrive in Leh (11,500 ft) and drive to Rumtse (13,100 ft), the starting point of the trek. The drive passes through scenic Ladakhi landscapes and the Indus valley. Acclimatize and explore Rumtse village. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp.

stops.title: Rumtse to Kyamar
stops.description: Begin trekking from Rumtse to Kyamar (14,100 ft). The trail ascends gradually through open valleys and grazing grounds, with views of the surrounding mountains. Camp at Kyamar.

stops.title: Kyamar to Tisaling via Kyamar La and Mandalchan La
stops.description: Trek from Kyamar to Tisaling (15,600 ft), crossing two high passes: Kyamar La (16,100 ft) and Mandalchan La (15,900 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Changthang plateau. Camp at Tisaling.

stops.title: Tisaling to Ponganagu via Shibuk La
stops.description: Trek from Tisaling to Ponganagu (14,300 ft), crossing Shibuk La (16,600 ft), the highest pass so far. Descend to the shores of Tso Kar, a beautiful salt lake. Camp at Ponganagu.

stops.title: Ponganagu to Nuruchan
stops.description: Trek along the shores of Tso Kar and through wide valleys to Nuruchan (15,000 ft), a small nomadic settlement. The trail is mostly flat, with views of grazing yaks and wild asses (kiang). Camp at Nuruchan.

stops.title: Nuruchan to Gyamar Barma via Horlam Kongka La
stops.description: Trek from Nuruchan to Gyamar Barma (15,900 ft), crossing Horlam Kongka La (16,400 ft). The trail passes through high-altitude meadows and streams. Camp at Gyamar Barma.

stops.title: Gyamar Barma to Gyamar via Kyamayuri La
stops.description: Trek from Gyamar Barma to Gyamar (17,100 ft), crossing Kyamayuri La (17,600 ft), the highest pass of the trek. Enjoy spectacular views of the Changthang region. Camp at Gyamar.

stops.title: Gyamar to Korzok via Yalung Nyau La
stops.description: Trek from Gyamar to Korzok (15,100 ft), crossing Yalung Nyau La (17,848 ft), the highest point of the trek. Descend to the village of Korzok on the banks of Tso Moriri Lake. Celebrate the completion of your trek.

stops.title: Rest/Exploration Day at Tso Moriri
stops.description: Spend the day exploring Korzok village and the stunning Tso Moriri Lake. Visit the ancient Korzok Monastery, interact with local Changpa nomads, and enjoy the tranquility of the high-altitude lake.

stops.title: Korzok to Leh (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Korzok to Leh (11,500 ft), passing through the Changthang plateau and crossing Namshang La and Mahe Bridge. Arrive in Leh by evening.

data.title: Rupin Pass
data.description: Rupin Pass Trek is a classic Himalayan adventure, featuring dramatic waterfalls, hanging villages, and the thrilling Rupin Pass crossing. The trail is known for its ever-changing scenery and challenging terrain, making it a favorite among seasoned trekkers.

stops.title: Shimla to Dhaula (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Shimla (7,200 ft) to Dhaula (5,100 ft), the starting point of the trek. The journey passes through Narkanda, Rohru, and winding mountain roads. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp at Dhaula.

stops.title: Dhaula to Sewa
stops.description: Trek from Dhaula to Sewa (6,300 ft), passing through mixed forests, small villages, and terraced fields. Visit the unique temple at Sewa. Camp or stay in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Sewa to Jiskun
stops.description: Trek from Sewa to Jiskun (7,700 ft), crossing the Rupin River into Himachal Pradesh. The trail ascends through forests and remote hamlets. Camp or stay in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Jiskun to Udaknal via Jakha
stops.description: Trek from Jiskun to Udaknal (10,000 ft) via Jakha, the highest and last village on the route. The trail climbs steeply through forests and opens up to alpine meadows. Camp at Udaknal.

stops.title: Udaknal to Dhanderas Thatch (Lower Waterfall Camp)
stops.description: Trek from Udaknal to Dhanderas Thatch (11,700 ft), a vast meadow at the base of the famous Rupin waterfall. The trail passes through forests, snow bridges, and streams. Camp at Dhanderas Thatch.

stops.title: Dhanderas Thatch to Upper Waterfall Camp
stops.description: Ascend steeply beside the Rupin waterfall to Upper Waterfall Camp (13,100 ft). The trail involves snow patches and boulder hopping. Enjoy panoramic views of the valley. Camp at Upper Waterfall.

stops.title: Upper Waterfall Camp to Rupin Pass (15,279 ft) and descend to Ronti Gad
stops.description: The most challenging day. Early morning ascent to Rupin Pass (15,279 ft), the highest point of the trek, with breathtaking views of the Kinnaur and Garhwal ranges. Descend steeply to Ronti Gad (13,100 ft). Camp at Ronti Gad.

stops.title: Ronti Gad to Sangla Kanda, descend to Sangla
