stops.description: Descend from Ronti Gad to Sangla Kanda meadows and further down to Sangla (8,600 ft) in the Baspa Valley. The trail passes through pine forests and traditional Kinnauri villages. Trek ends at Sangla.

data.title: Sandakphu Phalut Trek
data.description: Sandakphu Phalut Trek is the highest trek in West Bengal, offering views of four of the world's tallest peaks: Everest, Kanchenjunga, Lhotse, and Makalu. The trail passes through rhododendron forests, charming villages, and the unique Singalila ridge.

stops.title: NJP/Bagdogra to Manebhanjan (Drive)
stops.description: Arrive at NJP railway station or Bagdogra airport and drive to Manebhanjan (6,900 ft), the gateway to Singalila National Park. The drive passes through tea gardens and forests. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Manebhanjan to Tumling
stops.description: Begin trekking from Manebhanjan to Tumling (9,600 ft). The trail ascends through forests and small settlements, entering Singalila National Park. Enjoy views of the Kanchenjunga range. Overnight in a tea house.

stops.title: Tumling to Kalipokhri
stops.description: Trek from Tumling to Kalipokhri (10,400 ft), passing through the border village of Jaubari and the scenic Gairibas. The trail undulates through rhododendron forests and meadows. Overnight in a tea house.

stops.title: Kalipokhri to Sandakphu
stops.description: Trek from Kalipokhri to Sandakphu (11,930 ft), the highest point in West Bengal. The trail climbs steadily, offering the first panoramic views of Everest, Lhotse, Makalu, and Kanchenjunga. Overnight in a tea house.

stops.title: Sandakphu to Phalut
stops.description: Trek along the Singalila ridge from Sandakphu to Phalut (11,800 ft), with continuous views of the worlds highest peaks. The trail passes through meadows and forests. Overnight in a trekkers hut.

stops.title: Phalut to Gorkhey
stops.description: Descend from Phalut to Gorkhey (7,500 ft), a picturesque village at the confluence of two streams. The trail passes through dense forests and bamboo groves. Overnight in a homestay.

stops.title: Gorkhey to Sepi, drive to NJP/Bagdogra
stops.description: Trek from Gorkhey to Sepi (6,200 ft), passing through Samanden and Rammam villages. Board vehicles for the drive back to NJP/Bagdogra, marking the end of your Sandakphu Phalut adventure.

data.title: Sar Pass Trek
data.description: The Sar Pass Trek is a delightful journey that offers stunning views of the Parvati Valley and the surrounding peaks. The trek takes you through beautiful forests, lush meadows, and charming villages. The pass itself offers a breathtaking view of the surrounding peaks and valleys. This trek is perfect for those seeking a scenic and culturally rich trekking experience.

stops.title: Arrive in Kasol, trek to Grahan
stops.description: Arrive in Kasol (5,100 ft), a scenic village in Parvati Valley. Begin trekking along the Grahan Nallah through pine forests and small clearings to reach Grahan village (7,700 ft). Overnight in a guesthouse or camp.

stops.title: Grahan to Min Thach
stops.description: Trek from Grahan to Min Thach (9,700 ft), passing through dense forests and alpine meadows. The trail offers beautiful views of the Parvati Valley and surrounding peaks. Camp at Min Thach.

stops.title: Min Thach to Nagaru
stops.description: Ascend from Min Thach to Nagaru (12,500 ft), the highest campsite of the trek. The trail climbs steeply through forests and opens up to snowfields and panoramic mountain views. Camp at Nagaru.

stops.title: Nagaru to Sar Pass (13,797 ft) and descend to Biskeri Thach
stops.description: Early morning ascent to Sar Pass (13,797 ft), the highest point of the trek. Enjoy breathtaking views of the Himalayas. Descend through snowfields and meadows to Biskeri Thach (11,000 ft). Camp at Biskeri Thach.

stops.title: Biskeri Thach to Barshaini via Pulga, depart
stops.description: Descend from Biskeri Thach through forests and small villages to Barshaini (7,800 ft), passing Pulga and Tulga. Board vehicles for onward travel. Trek ends.

data.title: Satopanth Lake Trek
data.description: The Satopanth Lake Trek is a stunning and moderately challenging trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the beautiful Satopanth Lake and offering breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys. The trek also takes you through dense forests of oak and rhododendron, and past traditional villages and terraced fields. Trekkers will have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people, and to enjoy the vibrant flora and fauna of the region. This trek is perfect for those seeking a blend of adventure, natural beauty, and cultural immersion.

stops.title: Rishikesh/Haridwar to Badrinath (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Rishikesh/Haridwar (1,030 ft) to Badrinath (10,200 ft), passing through Devprayag, Rudraprayag, and Joshimath. Arrive in Badrinath by evening. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Badrinath to Mana, trek to Laxmivan
stops.description: Short drive to Mana (10,500 ft), the last village before Tibet. Begin trek to Laxmivan (11,800 ft) through lush meadows and birch forests. Camp at Laxmivan.

stops.title: Laxmivan to Chakratirth
stops.description: Trek from Laxmivan to Chakratirth (13,100 ft), passing through Vasudhara Falls and rocky terrain. Enjoy views of Chaukhamba and Neelkanth peaks. Camp at Chakratirth.

stops.title: Chakratirth to Satopanth Lake
stops.description: Trek from Chakratirth to Satopanth Lake (14,400 ft), the highlight of the trek. The trail ascends steeply over moraines and glacial terrain. Explore the sacred lake and its surroundings. Camp near Satopanth Lake.

stops.title: Satopanth Lake to Chakratirth
stops.description: After sunrise at the lake, retrace your steps back to Chakratirth. Enjoy the changing views of the valley and peaks. Camp at Chakratirth.

stops.title: Chakratirth to Mana, drive to Badrinath
stops.description: Descend from Chakratirth to Mana, passing through Laxmivan. Board vehicles for the short drive to Badrinath. Rest and explore the temple town.

stops.title: Badrinath to Rishikesh/Haridwar (Drive)
stops.description: Drive back from Badrinath to Rishikesh/Haridwar, marking the end of your Satopanth Lake adventure.

data.title: Stok Kangri Peak Trek Expedition
data.description: The Stok Kangri Peak Trek Expedition is a challenging and rewarding trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking adventurers to the summit of Stok Kangri Peak at an altitude of 20,180 ft. The trek offers stunning views of the surrounding peaks, glaciers, and valleys, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This expedition is perfect for experienced trekkers seeking a true wilderness adventure in one of the world's most spectacular mountain ranges.

stops.title: Arrive in Leh (Acclimatization Day)
stops.description: Arrive in Leh (11,500 ft). Rest and acclimatize to the high altitude. Explore the local market, visit monasteries, and prepare for the trek. Overnight in a guesthouse or hotel.

stops.title: Leh Acclimatization and Sightseeing
stops.description: Second day in Leh for acclimatization. Optional sightseeing to Shey Palace, Thiksey Monastery, and Hemis Monastery. Briefing and equipment check in the evening. Overnight in Leh.

stops.title: Leh to Stok Village (Drive), trek to Chang Ma
stops.description: Drive from Leh to Stok Village (11,800 ft), the trek starting point. Trek along the Stok Chu river to Chang Ma (13,100 ft), passing through barren landscapes and crossing small streams. Camp at Chang Ma.

stops.title: Chang Ma to Mankorma
stops.description: Trek from Chang Ma to Mankorma (14,200 ft). The trail ascends gradually through rocky terrain and river crossings, with views of Stok Kangri and surrounding peaks. Camp at Mankorma.

stops.title: Mankorma to Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Mankorma to Stok Kangri Base Camp (16,300 ft). The trail climbs steadily, passing glacial streams and alpine meadows. Set up camp at the base of Stok Kangri.

stops.title: Rest and Acclimatization at Base Camp
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Base Camp. Practice technical skills, equipment check, and short hikes to higher elevations. Prepare for the summit attempt.

stops.title: Base Camp to Stok Kangri Summit (20,180 ft) and return
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push. Climb steep scree and snow slopes to reach Stok Kangri summit (20,180 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Zanskar and Karakoram ranges. Descend carefully back to Base Camp.

stops.title: Base Camp to Stok Village, drive to Leh
stops.description: Descend from Base Camp to Stok Village, retracing your steps along the Stok Chu river. Board vehicles for the drive back to Leh. Celebrate the successful expedition.

stops.title: Departure from Leh
stops.description: Depart from Leh for your onward journey, carrying memories of your Stok Kangri adventure.

data.title: Sumda Chey Winter Trek
data.description: The Sumda Chey Winter Trek is a unique and challenging journey in Ladakh, taking you through the stunning landscapes of the Indus Valley and the beautiful Sumda Chey village. The trek offers a chance to experience the rich biodiversity of the region and the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for adventure enthusiasts and those seeking a truly unique experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Arrive in Leh (Acclimatization Day)
stops.description: Arrive in Leh (11,500 ft). Rest and acclimatize to the high altitude. Explore the local market and monasteries if time permits. Overnight in a guesthouse or hotel.

stops.title: Leh Acclimatization and Sightseeing
stops.description: Second day in Leh for acclimatization. Optional sightseeing to Shey Palace, Thiksey Monastery, and Hemis Monastery. Briefing and equipment check in the evening. Overnight in Leh.

stops.title: Leh to Chilling (Drive), trek to Skiu
stops.description: Drive from Leh to Chilling (10,400 ft), the trek starting point. Cross the Zanskar River and trek along the Markha Valley to Skiu (11,150 ft). Camp overnight.

stops.title: Skiu to Sumda Chun
stops.description: Trek from Skiu to Sumda Chun (12,800 ft), a remote village famous for its ancient monastery. The trail passes through frozen streams, narrow gorges, and snow-covered landscapes. Camp at Sumda Chun.

stops.title: Sumda Chun to Sumda Chey
stops.description: Trek from Sumda Chun to Sumda Chey (14,898 ft), the highest point of the trek. The trail climbs steadily through snowfields and high-altitude meadows. Enjoy panoramic views of the Ladakh ranges. Camp at Sumda Chey.

stops.title: Explore Sumda Chey and Surroundings
stops.description: Spend the day exploring Sumda Chey and its surroundings. Take short hikes to nearby ridges for views of the Indus Valley and surrounding peaks. Experience the winter solitude and unique culture of the region.

stops.title: Sumda Chey to Sumda Chun
stops.description: Descend from Sumda Chey to Sumda Chun, retracing your steps through snowfields and frozen streams. Camp at Sumda Chun.

stops.title: Sumda Chun to Chilling, drive to Leh
stops.description: Trek from Sumda Chun to Chilling. Board vehicles for the drive back to Leh. Celebrate the completion of your winter trek.

stops.title: Departure from Leh
stops.description: Depart from Leh for your onward journey, carrying memories of your Sumda Chey Winter Trek.

data.title: Surya Top
data.description: Surya Top Trek is a lesser-known gem in Uttarakhand, featuring snowfields, meadows, and panoramic views of the Yamunotri and Gangotri ranges. The trail is ideal for those seeking solitude and a challenging Himalayan experience.

stops.title: Dehradun to Raithal (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Raithal (7,400 ft), a picturesque village in Uttarkashi district. The journey passes through Mussoorie, Uttarkashi, and beautiful Himalayan valleys. Overnight in a guesthouse or homestay.

stops.title: Raithal to Gui
stops.description: Trek from Raithal to Gui (9,500 ft), a beautiful meadow surrounded by forests and mountain views. The trail ascends gradually through oak and rhododendron forests. Camp at Gui.

stops.title: Gui to Chilapada
stops.description: Trek from Gui to Chilapada (11,000 ft), passing through alpine meadows and forests. The trail offers panoramic views of the Gangotri and Yamunotri ranges. Camp at Chilapada.

stops.title: Chilapada to Surya Top Summit (12,900 ft) and back to Chilapada
stops.description: Early morning ascent to Surya Top (12,900 ft), the highest point of the trek. Enjoy breathtaking views of Bandarpoonch, Draupadi Ka Danda, and the Gangotri range. Descend back to Chilapada for overnight camp.

stops.title: Chilapada to Raithal, drive to Dehradun
stops.description: Descend from Chilapada to Raithal, retracing your steps through forests and meadows. Board vehicles for the drive back to Dehradun, marking the end of your Surya Top adventure.

data.title: Tarsar Marsar Trek
data.description: Tarsar Marsar Trek in Kashmir is a journey to two of the most beautiful alpine lakes in the region. The trail meanders through meadows, pine forests, and remote valleys, offering tranquility and breathtaking scenery.

stops.title: Srinagar to Aru (Drive)
stops.description: Arrive in Srinagar (5,200 ft) and drive to Aru (7,950 ft), a picturesque village near Pahalgam and the starting point of the trek. The drive passes through Anantnag and Pahalgam, following the Lidder River. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp at Aru.

stops.title: Aru to Lidderwat
stops.description: Begin trekking from Aru to Lidderwat (9,150 ft). The trail passes through pine forests, lush meadows, and alongside the Lidder River. Enjoy views of the surrounding mountains and spot local shepherds with their flocks. Camp at Lidderwat.

stops.title: Lidderwat to Shekwas
stops.description: Trek from Lidderwat to Shekwas (11,000 ft), a beautiful meadow surrounded by snow-capped peaks. The trail ascends gradually through birch forests and alpine pastures. Camp at Shekwas.

stops.title: Shekwas to Tarsar Lake
stops.description: Ascend from Shekwas to Tarsar Lake (12,450 ft), the first of the twin lakes. The trail climbs steadily, opening up to breathtaking views of the turquoise lake surrounded by mountains. Camp by the lakeshore.

stops.title: Tarsar Lake to Sundersar via Tarsar Pass
stops.description: Climb to Tarsar Pass (13,165 ft) for panoramic views, then descend to Sundersar (12,800 ft), a high-altitude meadow with a pristine lake. The trail offers views of the Kolahoi and surrounding peaks. Camp at Sundersar.

stops.title: Sundersar to Marsar Lake and back to Homwas
stops.description: Early morning hike to Marsar Lake (13,165 ft), hidden behind a ridge and often shrouded in mist. Spend time at the lake, then return to Sundersar and descend to Homwas (11,500 ft) for overnight camp.

stops.title: Homwas to Aru, drive to Srinagar
stops.description: Descend from Homwas to Aru, retracing your steps through meadows and forests. Board vehicles for the drive back to Srinagar, marking the end of your Tarsar Marsar adventure.

data.title: Tulian Lake Trek
data.description: Tulian Lake Trek is a short and scenic trek in Kashmir, leading to the pristine Tulian Lake surrounded by snow-capped peaks. The trail passes through pine forests, meadows, and offers a peaceful Himalayan escape.

stops.title: Srinagar to Pahalgam (Drive)
stops.description: Arrive in Srinagar (5,200 ft) and drive to Pahalgam (7,200 ft), a scenic town in the Lidder Valley. The drive passes through Anantnag and lush countryside. Acclimatize and explore Pahalgam. Overnight in a guesthouse or hotel.

stops.title: Pahalgam to Baisaran
stops.description: Begin trekking from Pahalgam to Baisaran (8,200 ft), a beautiful meadow surrounded by pine forests and mountains. The trail ascends gradually through forests and open clearings. Camp at Baisaran.

stops.title: Baisaran to Tulian Valley Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Baisaran to Tulian Valley Base Camp (10,000 ft), passing through dense forests, meadows, and streams. The trail offers views of snow-capped peaks and wildflowers in season. Camp at the base of Tulian Valley.

stops.title: Base Camp to Tulian Lake (12,087 ft) and return to Baisaran
stops.description: Early morning trek to Tulian Lake, a pristine alpine lake surrounded by high mountains. Spend time at the lake, enjoy the views, and return to Baisaran for overnight camp.

stops.title: Baisaran to Pahalgam, drive to Srinagar
stops.description: Descend from Baisaran to Pahalgam, retracing your steps through forests and meadows. Board vehicles for the drive back to Srinagar, marking the end of your Tulian Lake adventure.

data.title: Twin Peak - Kang Yatse II, Dzo Jongo, Markha Valley Trek
data.description: The Twin Peak - Kang Yatse II, Dzo Jongo, Markha Valley Trek is a challenging and rewarding trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking adventurers to the summits of Kang Yatse II and Dzo Jongo, and through the beautiful Markha Valley. The trek offers stunning views of the surrounding peaks, glaciers, and valleys, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for experienced trekkers seeking a true wilderness adventure in one of the world's most spectacular mountain ranges.

stops.title: Arrive in Leh (Acclimatization Day)
stops.description: Arrive in Leh (11,500 ft). Rest and acclimatize to the high altitude. Explore the local market and monasteries if time permits. Overnight in a guesthouse or hotel.

stops.title: Leh Acclimatization and Sightseeing
stops.description: Second day in Leh for acclimatization. Optional sightseeing to Shey Palace, Thiksey Monastery, and Hemis Monastery. Briefing and equipment check in the evening. Overnight in Leh.

stops.title: Leh to Chilling (Drive), trek to Skiu
stops.description: Drive from Leh to Chilling (10,400 ft), the trek starting point. Cross the Zanskar River and trek along the Markha Valley to Skiu (11,150 ft). Camp overnight.

stops.title: Skiu to Markha
stops.description: Trek along the Markha River, crossing several streams and passing through small villages and barley fields. Reach Markha (12,370 ft), the largest village in the valley. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Markha to Thachungtse
stops.description: Continue trekking through the Markha Valley, passing monasteries and mani walls. Gradual ascent to Thachungtse (13,300 ft), a beautiful campsite surrounded by mountains.

stops.title: Thachungtse to Nimaling
stops.description: Trek from Thachungtse to Nimaling (15,400 ft), the high-altitude grazing ground for local herders. The trail offers spectacular views of Kang Yatse massif. Camp at Nimaling.

stops.title: Nimaling to Kang Yatse II Base Camp
stops.description: Short trek from Nimaling to Kang Yatse II Base Camp (16,730 ft). Set up camp and rest. Briefing and technical training for the summit attempt.

stops.title: Rest and Training at Base Camp
stops.description: Acclimatization and technical training day at Base Camp. Practice using crampons, ice axe, and ropes. Short acclimatization hikes in the area. Prepare for the summit push.

stops.title: Summit Kang Yatse II (20,500 ft) and return to Base Camp
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push. Climb steep snow and scree slopes to reach the summit of Kang Yatse II (20,500 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Zanskar and Ladakh ranges. Descend carefully back to Base Camp.

stops.title: Base Camp to Dzo Jongo Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Kang Yatse II Base Camp to Dzo Jongo Base Camp (17,000 ft), traversing high-altitude meadows and rocky terrain. Set up camp and rest.

stops.title: Summit Dzo Jongo (20,500 ft) and return to Base Camp
stops.description: Start early for the summit attempt of Dzo Jongo. Climb steep snow and rocky slopes to the summit (20,500 ft). Enjoy the views, then descend to Base Camp.

stops.title: Base Camp to Chokdo via Kongmaru La, drive to Leh
stops.description: Trek from Base Camp over Kongmaru La Pass (17,060 ft), the highest pass on the route, with spectacular views. Descend to Chokdo (13,100 ft) and drive back to Leh. Overnight in Leh.

stops.title: Departure from Leh
stops.description: Depart from Leh for your onward journey, carrying memories of your twin peak and Markha Valley adventure.

data.title: Valley Of Flowers Trek
data.description: The Valley of Flowers Trek is a UNESCO World Heritage site and a paradise for nature lovers. The trek takes you through a vibrant carpet of endemic alpine flowers, lush green meadows, and pristine rivers. The valley is also home to a diverse range of flora and fauna, including the elusive snow leopard. This trek is ideal for those seeking a unique and breathtaking natural experience.

stops.title: Rishikesh/Haridwar to Govindghat (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Rishikesh/Haridwar (1,030 ft) to Govindghat (6,000 ft), passing through Devprayag, Rudraprayag, and Joshimath. Arrive in Govindghat by evening. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Govindghat to Ghangaria
stops.description: Begin trekking from Govindghat to Ghangaria (10,000 ft), following the Pushpawati River through pine forests and small villages. The trail is well-marked and passes several tea houses. Overnight in a guesthouse at Ghangaria.

stops.title: Ghangaria to Valley of Flowers and back
stops.description: Trek from Ghangaria to the Valley of Flowers (11,500 ft), exploring the UNESCO World Heritage Site filled with alpine flowers and streams. Spend time in the valley, then return to Ghangaria for overnight stay.

stops.title: Ghangaria to Hemkund Sahib and back
stops.description: Trek from Ghangaria to Hemkund Sahib (14,100 ft), a revered Sikh pilgrimage site beside a glacial lake. The trail is steep and challenging. After visiting the Gurudwara, descend back to Ghangaria.

stops.title: Ghangaria to Govindghat, drive to Joshimath
stops.description: Descend from Ghangaria to Govindghat, retracing your steps. Board vehicles for the short drive to Joshimath (6,150 ft). Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Joshimath to Rishikesh/Haridwar (Drive)
stops.description: Drive back from Joshimath to Rishikesh/Haridwar, marking the end of your Valley of Flowers adventure.

data.title: Vasuki Tal Trek
data.description: The Vasuki Tal Trek is a challenging and rewarding journey in the Indian Himalayas, taking you to the stunning Vasuki Tal, a high-altitude lake known for its pristine beauty and tranquility. The trek offers breathtaking views of the surrounding peaks and valleys, and a chance to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This trek is perfect for adventure enthusiasts and those seeking a truly unique experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Dehradun to Gangotri (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Dehradun (2,200 ft) to Gangotri (10,000 ft), the starting point of the trek. The journey passes through Uttarkashi and follows the Bhagirathi River. Overnight in a guesthouse at Gangotri.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Exploration in Gangotri
stops.description: Spend the day acclimatizing in Gangotri. Visit the famous Gangotri Temple, explore the local market, and take a short acclimatization hike to nearby viewpoints. Attend trek briefing and equipment check in the evening.

stops.title: Gangotri to Chirbasa
stops.description: Trek from Gangotri to Chirbasa (11,700 ft), following the Bhagirathi River through pine forests and along a well-defined trail. Enjoy views of the Bhagirathi peaks. Chirbasa is a beautiful campsite surrounded by silver birch trees.

stops.title: Chirbasa to Bhojbasa
stops.description: Trek from Chirbasa to Bhojbasa (12,400 ft), the last campsite before Gaumukh. The trail gradually ascends, offering panoramic views of the Bhagirathi range. Bhojbasa is a wide, open campsite with a few ashrams and a clear view of the surrounding mountains.

stops.title: Bhojbasa to Nandanvan via Gaumukh
stops.description: Trek from Bhojbasa to Gaumukh (13,200 ft), the snout of the Gangotri Glacier and the source of the Ganges. Continue the steep ascent to Nandanvan (14,600 ft), a high-altitude meadow with breathtaking views of Shivling and Bhagirathi peaks. Camp at Nandanvan.

stops.title: Nandanvan to Vasuki Tal
stops.description: Trek from Nandanvan to Vasuki Tal (16,010 ft), a glacial lake surrounded by towering peaks. The trail traverses rocky moraines and offers stunning views of Mt. Satopanth and Vasuki Parbat. Camp near the lake.

stops.title: Explore Vasuki Tal and Surroundings
stops.description: Spend the day exploring Vasuki Tal and its surroundings. Take short hikes to nearby ridges for panoramic views or rest by the lake. This day also serves as a buffer for acclimatization.

stops.title: Vasuki Tal to Bhojbasa
stops.description: Descend from Vasuki Tal to Bhojbasa, retracing your steps via Nandanvan and Gaumukh. The descent offers new perspectives of the glacier and surrounding peaks. Camp at Bhojbasa.

stops.title: Bhojbasa to Gangotri, drive to Dehradun
stops.description: Trek from Bhojbasa to Gangotri, then drive back to Dehradun. The journey marks the end of your Vasuki Tal adventure.

data.title: Warwan Valley Trek
data.description: Warwan Valley Trek is a remote and challenging journey in Jammu and Kashmir, featuring wildflower meadows, glacial streams, and traditional villages. The trek offers solitude and a glimpse into the untouched beauty of the Himalayas.

stops.title: Srinagar to Panikhar (Drive)
stops.description: Arrive in Srinagar (5,200 ft) and drive to Panikhar (10,500 ft) in the Suru Valley, Ladakh. The journey passes through Sonamarg, Drass, and Kargil, offering views of Nun Kun peaks. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp at Panikhar.

stops.title: Panikhar to Denora
stops.description: Begin trekking from Panikhar to Denora (11,800 ft). The trail follows the Suru River, passing through meadows and small hamlets. Camp at Denora.

stops.title: Denora to Kalapari Base
stops.description: Trek from Denora to Kalapari Base (12,800 ft), crossing alpine meadows and glacial streams. The trail offers views of snow-capped peaks and wildflowers. Camp at Kalapari Base.

stops.title: Kalapari Base to Kaintal via Lomvilad Pass
stops.description: Ascend to Lomvilad Pass (14,495 ft), the highest point of the trek, with panoramic views of the Zanskar and Kashmir valleys. Descend to Kaintal (12,000 ft), a beautiful meadow. Camp at Kaintal.

stops.title: Kaintal to Sukhnai
stops.description: Trek from Kaintal to Sukhnai (10,500 ft), passing through pine forests, wildflower meadows, and remote villages. Interact with local Gujjar and Bakarwal communities. Camp at Sukhnai.

stops.title: Sukhnai to Warwan Valley (Stingray)
stops.description: Descend from Sukhnai to Stingray (8,500 ft), the main village in Warwan Valley. The trail passes through terraced fields, traditional wooden houses, and vibrant Himalayan scenery. Celebrate the completion of your trek.

stops.title: Stingray to Anantnag/Srinagar (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Stingray to Anantnag or Srinagar, passing through the remote valleys and scenic mountain roads of Kashmir. Trek ends.

data.title: Yunam Peak Trek Expedition
data.description: The Yunam Peak Trek Expedition is a challenging and rewarding trek in the Indian Himalayas, taking adventurers to the summit of Yunam Peak at an altitude of 20,100 ft. The trek offers stunning views of the surrounding peaks, glaciers, and valleys, and takes you through a diverse range of landscapes, from lush green meadows and forests to barren high-altitude deserts. Trekkers will also have the opportunity to experience the unique culture and traditions of the local people. This expedition is perfect for experienced trekkers seeking a true wilderness adventure in one of the world's most spectacular mountain ranges.

stops.title: Arrive in Manali (Acclimatization Day)
stops.description: Arrive in Manali (6,725 ft). Meet your trek leader and team, attend a briefing session, and check equipment. Rest and acclimatize to the altitude. Overnight in a hotel or guesthouse.

stops.title: Manali to Jispa (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Manali to Jispa (10,500 ft) via the scenic Atal Tunnel and Keylong. The journey offers stunning views of the Lahaul valley and Chandra-Bhaga ranges. Acclimatize and explore Jispa village. Overnight in a guesthouse or camp.

stops.title: Jispa to Bharatpur (Drive)
stops.description: Drive from Jispa to Bharatpur (15,000 ft), a high-altitude campsite near Baralacha La. The route passes through Darcha, Zing Zing Bar, and Suraj Tal. Rest and acclimatize at Bharatpur. Overnight in tents.

stops.title: Bharatpur to Yunam Base Camp (Trek)
stops.description: Trek from Bharatpur to Yunam Base Camp (16,240 ft). The trail ascends gradually over moraines and high-altitude desert terrain. Set up camp and rest. Briefing and acclimatization walks.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Training at Base Camp
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Yunam Base Camp. Practice using technical equipment, review summit strategy, and take short acclimatization hikes. Prepare for the summit attempt.

stops.title: Summit Yunam Peak (20,100 ft) and return to Base Camp
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push. Climb steep scree and snow slopes to reach Yunam Peak (20,100 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Lahaul and Zanskar ranges. Descend carefully back to Base Camp.

stops.title: Base Camp to Bharatpur, drive to Jispa
stops.description: Descend from Base Camp to Bharatpur. Board vehicles for the drive back to Jispa. Celebrate the successful expedition with your team.

stops.title: Jispa to Manali (Drive) and Departure
stops.description: Drive from Jispa to Manali, marking the end of your Yunam Peak adventure. Depart from Manali for your onward journey.

data.title: Kinnaur Kailash Trek
data.description: The Kinnaur Kailash Trek is a challenging and spiritual journey in Himachal Pradesh, leading trekkers to the revered Kinnaur Kailash Shivling at 4,800m. The trail passes through remote villages, dense forests, alpine meadows, and rocky terrain, offering panoramic views of the Kinnaur and Zanskar ranges. This trek is ideal for experienced trekkers seeking adventure and a deep cultural experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Shimla to Tangling Village (Drive)
stops.description: Arrive in Shimla and drive to Tangling village (2,400m), the trek base. The drive takes 89 hours (250 km) through scenic Kinnaur valley. Overnight in homestay/tent.

stops.title: Tangling to Ganesh Park
stops.description: Begin trek from Tangling village. Ascend through forests, meadows, and streams to Ganesh Park (3,600m). Camp overnight.

stops.title: Ganesh Park to Parvati Kund
stops.description: Steep ascent through rocky terrain to Parvati Kund (4,500m), a sacred high-altitude lake. Camp near Parvati Kund.

stops.title: Parvati Kund to Kinnaur Kailash Shivling and back
stops.description: Early morning trek to Kinnaur Kailash Shivling (4,800m), a 79-foot vertical rock pillar. Spend time at the Shivling, then return to Parvati Kund camp.

stops.title: Parvati Kund to Ganesh Park
stops.description: Descend from Parvati Kund to Ganesh Park, retracing your steps. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Ganesh Park to Tangling, drive to Reckong Peo/Kalpa
stops.description: Descend to Tangling village. Drive to Reckong Peo or Kalpa (1 hour). Overnight in hotel/guesthouse.

stops.title: Reckong Peo/Kalpa to Shimla (Drive)
stops.description: Drive back to Shimla (8-9 hours, 250 km). Trek ends.

data.title: Manimahesh Trek
data.description: The Manimahesh Trek is a sacred pilgrimage and adventure in Himachal Pradesh, leading trekkers to the revered Manimahesh Lake at 4,080m, beneath the mighty Manimahesh Kailash peak. The trail passes through remote villages, dense forests, alpine meadows, and rocky terrain, offering spiritual significance and panoramic views of the Pir Panjal and Dhauladhar ranges. This trek is ideal for trekkers seeking both adventure and a deep cultural experience in the Himalayas.

stops.title: Arrival at Bharmour
stops.description: Arrive at Bharmour (2,195m) from Chamba (65 km by road). Acclimatize and visit Chaurasi Temple. Overnight in guesthouse/homestay.

stops.title: Bharmour to Hadsar (Drive), trek to Dhancho
stops.description: Drive to Hadsar (13 km). Trek from Hadsar to Dhancho (3,040m), passing through forests and streams. Camp at Dhancho.

stops.title: Dhancho to Manimahesh Lake
stops.description: Trek from Dhancho to Manimahesh Lake (4,080m) via Gauri Kund and Shiv Karotri. Steep ascent. Explore the sacred lake and temple. Camp near the lake.

stops.title: Manimahesh Lake to Dhancho to Hadsar, drive to Bharmour
stops.description: Early morning visit to the lake. Trek back to Dhancho and Hadsar (14 km total). Drive to Bharmour. Overnight in guesthouse/homestay.

stops.title: Bharmour to Chamba/Departure
stops.description: Drive back to Chamba or onward destination. Trek ends.

data.title: Rudranath Trek
data.description: The Rudranath Trek is a spiritual and scenic journey in Uttarakhand, leading trekkers to the revered Rudranath Temple, one of the Panch Kedar shrines dedicated to Lord Shiva. The trail passes through dense forests, alpine meadows, and remote villages, offering panoramic views of the Garhwal Himalayas. This trek is ideal for those seeking a blend of adventure, natural beauty, and spiritual experience.

stops.title: Rishikesh/Haridwar to Sagar Village (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Rishikesh/Haridwar (1,030 ft) to Sagar Village (6,500 ft) via Gopeshwar (approx. 220 km, 810 hours). Overnight in guesthouse/homestay.

stops.title: Sagar Village to Panar Bugyal
stops.description: Trek from Sagar Village to Panar Bugyal (11,000 ft), passing through dense forests of oak and rhododendron. The trail offers beautiful views of the Garhwal Himalayas. Camp at Panar Bugyal.

stops.title: Panar Bugyal to Rudranath Temple and back to Panar
stops.description: Trek from Panar Bugyal to Rudranath Temple (11,800 ft), a revered shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva. Explore the temple and enjoy panoramic mountain views. Return to Panar Bugyal for overnight camp.

stops.title: Panar Bugyal to Sagar Village
stops.description: Descend from Panar Bugyal to Sagar Village, retracing your steps through forests and meadows. Overnight in guesthouse/homestay.

stops.title: Sagar Village to Rishikesh/Haridwar (Drive)
stops.description: Drive back from Sagar Village to Rishikesh/Haridwar, marking the end of your Rudranath adventure.

data.title: Srikhand Mahadev Trek
data.description: The Srikhand Mahadev Trek is a challenging pilgrimage and adventure in Himachal Pradesh, leading trekkers to the sacred Srikhand Mahadev peak (5,227m/17,150 ft), believed to be the abode of Lord Shiva. The trail passes through dense forests, alpine meadows, glacial streams, and rocky moraines, offering panoramic views of the Himalayas. This trek is ideal for experienced trekkers and devotees seeking a blend of spiritual significance and high-altitude adventure.

stops.title: Shimla to Jaon Village (Drive)
stops.description: Arrive in Shimla and drive to Jaon Village (6,500 ft), the trek base. The drive takes 89 hours (approx. 180 km) via Rampur and Nirmand. Overnight in homestay/tent.

stops.title: Jaon to Thachru
stops.description: Begin trek from Jaon. Ascend steeply through forests and meadows to Thachru (11,000 ft). The trail passes Barati Nala and dense pine forests. Camp at Thachru.

stops.title: Thachru to Bhim Dwar via Kali Ghati
stops.description: Trek from Thachru to Bhim Dwar (12,500 ft) via Kali Ghati (12,800 ft). The trail ascends to Kali Ghati Pass, then descends through meadows and streams to Bhim Dwar. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Bhim Dwar to Parvati Bagh
stops.description: Trek from Bhim Dwar to Parvati Bagh (13,800 ft), a beautiful meadow filled with wildflowers. The trail passes through rocky terrain and glacial streams. Camp at Parvati Bagh.

stops.title: Parvati Bagh to Srikhand Mahadev Summit (17,150 ft) and back to Bhim Dwar
stops.description: Early morning summit push to Srikhand Mahadev (17,150 ft), a revered rock Shivling. The trail is steep, rocky, and crosses glaciers. After darshan, descend to Bhim Dwar for overnight camp.

stops.title: Bhim Dwar to Jaon
stops.description: Descend from Bhim Dwar to Jaon, retracing your steps through meadows and forests. Overnight in homestay/tent.

stops.title: Jaon to Shimla (Drive)
stops.description: Drive back from Jaon to  Shimla, marking the end of your Srikhand Mahadev adventure.

data.title: UT Kangri Expedition
data.description: UT Kangri Expedition is a challenging high-altitude trek in Ladakh, taking you to the summit of UT Kangri (20,500 ft). The trek offers breathtaking views of the Zanskar and Ladakh ranges, traverses remote valleys, and provides a true Himalayan adventure for experienced trekkers and mountaineers.

stops.title: Arrive in Leh (Acclimatization Day)
stops.description: Arrive in Leh (11,500 ft). Rest and acclimatize to the high altitude. Explore the local market and monasteries if time permits. Overnight in a guesthouse or hotel.

stops.title: Leh Acclimatization and Sightseeing
stops.description: Second day in Leh for acclimatization. Optional sightseeing to Shey Palace, Thiksey Monastery, and Hemis Monastery. Briefing and equipment check in the evening. Overnight in Leh.

stops.title: Leh to Stok Village (Drive), trek to Base Camp
stops.description: Drive from Leh to Stok Village (11,800 ft), the trek starting point. Trek along the Stok Chu river and ascend to UT Kangri Base Camp (16,000 ft). Set up camp and rest.

stops.title: Acclimatization and Training at Base Camp
stops.description: Rest and acclimatization day at Base Camp. Practice using technical equipment, review summit strategy, and take short acclimatization hikes. Prepare for the summit attempt.

stops.title: Base Camp to Advance Base Camp
stops.description: Trek from Base Camp to Advance Base Camp (17,200 ft), crossing moraines and snowfields. Set up camp and rest.

stops.title: Rest and Training at Advance Base Camp
stops.description: Acclimatization and technical training day at Advance Base Camp. Practice using crampons, ice axe, and ropes. Short acclimatization hikes in the area. Prepare for the summit push.

stops.title: Summit UT Kangri (20,500 ft) and return to Base Camp
stops.description: Start pre-dawn for the summit push. Climb steep snow and scree slopes to reach the summit of UT Kangri (20,500 ft). Enjoy panoramic views of the Zanskar and Ladakh ranges. Descend carefully back to Base Camp.

stops.title: Base Camp to Stok Village, drive to Leh
stops.description: Descend from Base Camp to Stok Village, retracing your steps along the Stok Chu river. Board vehicles for the drive back to Leh. Celebrate the successful expedition.

stops.title: Departure from Leh
stops.description: Depart from Leh for your onward journey, carrying memories of your UT Kangri adventure.

data.title: Panpatia Col Trek
data.description: The Panpatia Col Trek is one of the most challenging and remote high-altitude traverses in the Indian Himalayas, connecting the holy shrines of Badrinath and Kedarnath. The route crosses the Panpatia Glacier and the elusive Panpatia Col (17,257 ft), passing through dense forests, alpine meadows, moraine fields, and snowfields. This trek is ideal for experienced trekkers seeking adventure, solitude, and the thrill of a true Himalayan expedition.

stops.title: Rishikesh/Haridwar to Joshimath (Drive)
stops.description: Begin with a scenic drive from Rishikesh/Haridwar (1,030 ft) to Joshimath (6,725 ft), gateway to the Garhwal Himalayas. The 8-10 hour journey passes through Devprayag, Rudraprayag, and Chamoli. Overnight in a guesthouse or hotel at Joshimath.

stops.title: Joshimath to Badrinath (Drive), trek to Shepherd Camp
stops.description: Drive from Joshimath to Badrinath (10,200 ft). Begin trek to Shepherd Camp (11,000 ft) through alpine meadows and forests. Camp overnight.

stops.title: Shepherd Camp to Snout Camp
stops.description: Trek from Shepherd Camp to Snout Camp (12,500 ft), following the Alaknanda River and crossing boulder fields. Camp near the snout of the Panpatia Glacier.

stops.title: Snout Camp to Moraine Camp
stops.description: Trek from Snout Camp to Moraine Camp (13,500 ft), traversing glacial moraines and rocky terrain. The trail offers views of Chaukhamba and Neelkanth peaks. Camp at Moraine Camp.

stops.title: Moraine Camp to Base Camp
stops.description: Ascend from Moraine Camp to Panpatia Base Camp (15,000 ft), crossing snowfields and crevasses. The landscape becomes increasingly rugged and remote. Camp at Base Camp.

stops.title: Base Camp to Panpatia Col (17,257 ft), descend to Sujal Sarovar
stops.description: Early morning ascent to Panpatia Col (17,257 ft), the highest point of the trek. Enjoy breathtaking views of the Garhwal Himalayas. Descend to Sujal Sarovar (15,500 ft) for overnight camp.

stops.title: Sujal Sarovar to Kachni
stops.description: Descend from Sujal Sarovar to Kachni (13,500 ft), passing through snowfields and alpine meadows. Camp at Kachni.

stops.title: Kachni to Nanu Chatti
stops.description: Trek from Kachni to Nanu Chatti (11,000 ft), a small meadow surrounded by forests. The trail descends through rhododendron and birch forests. Camp at Nanu Chatti.

stops.title: Nanu Chatti to Madhmaheshwar
stops.description: Descend from Nanu Chatti to Madhmaheshwar (10,500 ft), one of the Panch Kedar temples. Explore the temple and surrounding meadows. Camp or stay in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Madhmaheshwar to Gaundhar
stops.description: Trek from Madhmaheshwar to Gaundhar (7,200 ft), passing through forests and small villages. Camp at Gaundhar.

stops.title: Gaundhar to Ransi, drive to Guptkashi
stops.description: Descend from Gaundhar to Ransi (6,600 ft), the roadhead. Drive to Guptkashi (4,300 ft), a major pilgrimage town. Overnight in a guesthouse.

stops.title: Guptkashi to Gaurikund (Drive), trek to Kedarnath
stops.description: Drive from Guptkashi to Gaurikund (6,600 ft), the starting point for the Kedarnath trek. Trek to Kedarnath (11,750 ft), one of the holiest shrines in India. Overnight in guesthouse or camp.

stops.title: Kedarnath to Gaurikund, drive to Rishikesh/Haridwar
stops.description: Descend from Kedarnath to Gaurikund. Board vehicles for the drive back to Rishikesh/Haridwar, marking the end of your Panpatia Col adventure.

data.title: Mount Everest
data.description: Mount Everest, the highest mountain in the world at 29,029 ft (8,848m), stands on the border of Nepal and China (Tibet). The Everest Expedition is the ultimate challenge for mountaineers, involving technical climbing, extreme altitude, and unpredictable weather. The ascent typically follows the South Col route from Nepal or the North Col route from Tibet. Climbers experience Sherpa culture, breathtaking Himalayan vistas, and the thrill of standing on top of the world.

stops.title: Arrive in Kathmandu / Lhasa
stops.description: Meet the expedition team, gear check, and final preparations.

stops.title: Fly to Lukla (Nepal route) / Drive to Base Camp (Tibet route)
stops.description: Begin trek to Everest Base Camp via Khumbu Valley (Nepal) or drive to Base Camp (Tibet).

stops.title: Trek to Everest Base Camp (Nepal route)
stops.description: Trek through Namche Bazaar, Tengboche, Dingboche, Lobuche, and Gorak Shep.

stops.title: Arrive at Everest Base Camp
stops.description: Acclimatization, training, and preparation for ascent.

stops.title: Climbing Period (Rotations)
stops.description: Multiple rotations to higher camps (Camp I, II, III, IV) for acclimatization and load ferry.

stops.title: Summit Push
stops.description: Climb from Base Camp to Camp IV (South Col), then summit attempt via Southeast Ridge (Nepal) or Northeast Ridge (Tibet).

stops.title: Descent to Base Camp
stops.description: Descend safely to Base Camp after summit.

stops.title: Return to Kathmandu / Lhasa
stops.description: Trek or drive back, celebration and departure.

data.title: K2
data.description: K2, the second highest mountain in the world at 28,251 ft (8,611m), stands on the border of Pakistan and China in the Karakoram Range. Known as the 'Savage Mountain', K2 is considered one of the most difficult and dangerous climbs due to its technical routes, unpredictable weather, and high fatality rate. The standard ascent follows the Abruzzi Spur from Pakistan. Climbers experience remote wilderness, dramatic glaciers, and the challenge of one of mountaineering's greatest prizes.

stops.title: Arrive in Islamabad
stops.description: Meet the expedition team, gear check, and final preparations.

stops.title: Fly/Drive to Skardu
stops.description: Travel to Skardu, gateway to the Karakoram.

stops.title: Drive to Askole
stops.description: Drive to Askole, the last village before the trek.

stops.title: Trek to Jhola
stops.description: Begin trek along the Braldu River to Jhola camp.

stops.title: Trek to Paiju
stops.description: Trek to Paiju, with views of the Trango Towers.

stops.title: Rest/Acclimatization at Paiju
stops.description: Rest day for acclimatization and preparation.

stops.title: Trek to Urdukas
stops.description: Trek along the Baltoro Glacier to Urdukas camp.

stops.title: Trek to Goro II
stops.description: Continue along the glacier to Goro II camp.

stops.title: Trek to Concordia
stops.description: Reach Concordia, the junction of major glaciers with views of K2.

stops.title: Trek to K2 Base Camp
stops.description: Arrive at K2 Base Camp, acclimatization and training.

stops.title: Climbing Period (Rotations)
stops.description: Multiple rotations to higher camps (Camp I, II, III, IV) for acclimatization and load ferry.

stops.title: Summit Push
stops.description: Climb from Base Camp to Camp IV, then summit attempt via Abruzzi Spur.

stops.title: Descent to Base Camp
stops.description: Descend safely to Base Camp after summit.

stops.title: Return to Skardu/Islamabad
stops.description: Trek and drive back, celebration and departure.

data.title: Kangchenjunga
data.description: Kangchenjunga, the third highest mountain in the world at 28,169 ft (8,586m), stands on the border of Nepal and India in the eastern Himalayas. The Kangchenjunga Expedition is a formidable challenge for mountaineers, involving technical climbing, remote wilderness, and unpredictable weather. The ascent typically follows the South-West Face from Nepal or the North-East Ridge from India. Climbers experience rich local culture, dramatic Himalayan vistas, and the thrill of summiting one of the world's highest peaks.

stops.title: Arrive in Kathmandu / Darjeeling
stops.description: Meet the expedition team, gear check, and final preparations.

stops.title: Fly/Drive to Taplejung (Nepal route) / Yuksom (India route)
stops.description: Travel to the trek starting point.

stops.title: Trek to Base Camp
stops.description: Trek through remote villages and forests to Kangchenjunga Base Camp.

stops.title: Arrive at Base Camp
stops.description: Acclimatization, training, and preparation for ascent.

stops.title: Climbing Period (Rotations)
stops.description: Multiple rotations to higher camps (Camp I, II, III, IV) for acclimatization and load ferry.

stops.title: Summit Push
stops.description: Climb from Base Camp to Camp IV, then summit attempt via South-West Face or North-East Ridge.

stops.title: Descent to Base Camp
stops.description: Descend safely to Base Camp after summit.

stops.title: Return to Kathmandu / Darjeeling
stops.description: Trek or drive back, celebration and departure.

data.title: Lhotse
data.description: Lhotse, the fourth highest mountain in the world at 27,940 ft (8,516m), is located next to Mount Everest in the Khumbu region of Nepal. The Lhotse Expedition is a demanding challenge for mountaineers, featuring technical climbing, exposure to high altitude, and unpredictable weather. The standard ascent follows the same route as Everest up to Camp III, then diverges to the Lhotse Couloir. Climbers experience Sherpa culture, dramatic Himalayan vistas, and the thrill of summiting one of the world's highest peaks.

stops.title: Trek to Everest Base Camp
stops.description: Pass through Tengboche, Dingboche, Lobuche, and Gorak Shep.

stops.title: Arrive at Base Camp
stops.description: Acclimatization, training, and preparation for ascent.

stops.title: Climbing Period (Rotations)
stops.description: Multiple rotations to higher camps (Camp I, II, III, IV) for acclimatization and load ferry.

stops.title: Summit Push
stops.description: Climb from Base Camp to Camp IV, then summit attempt via Lhotse Face and Lhotse Couloir.

stops.title: Descent to Base Camp
stops.description: Descend safely to Base Camp after summit.

stops.title: Return to Kathmandu
stops.description: Trek back to Lukla, fly to Kathmandu, celebration and departure.

data.title: Makalu
data.description: Makalu, the fifth highest mountain in the world at 27,838 ft (8,485m), stands in the Mahalangur Himalayas of Nepal, close to Everest. The Makalu Expedition is a formidable challenge for mountaineers, involving technical climbing, remote wilderness, and unpredictable weather. The ascent typically follows the Northwest Ridge from Nepal. Climbers experience rich local culture, dramatic Himalayan vistas, and the thrill of summiting one of the world's highest peaks.

data.title: Cho Oyu
data.description: Cho Oyu, the sixth highest mountain in the world at 26,864 ft (8,201m), stands on the border of Nepal and Tibet. Considered the 'easiest' eight-thousander due to its less technical standard route, Cho Oyu is a popular objective for climbers aiming for their first 8,000m peak. The ascent typically follows the Northwest Ridge from Tibet. Climbers experience dramatic Himalayan vistas and the challenge of high-altitude mountaineering.

data.title: Dhaulagiri
data.description: Dhaulagiri, the seventh highest mountain in the world at 26,795 ft (8,167m), stands in western Nepal. Presumed to be the world's highest from 1808-1838, Dhaulagiri is a formidable challenge for mountaineers, involving technical climbing, remote wilderness, and unpredictable weather. The ascent typically follows the Northeast Ridge from Nepal. Climbers experience dramatic Himalayan vistas and the thrill of summiting one of the world's highest peaks.

data.title: Manaslu
data.description: Manaslu, the eighth highest mountain in the world at 26,781 ft (8,163m), is located in the Mansiri Himal range of Nepal. Known as the 'Mountain of the Spirit', Manaslu is a popular objective for mountaineers seeking an 8,000-meter peak with relatively less technical difficulty compared to others in the region. The standard ascent route is via the Northeast Face, offering a blend of remote wilderness, Sherpa culture, and dramatic Himalayan vistas.

data.title: Nanga Parbat
data.description: Nanga Parbat, the ninth highest mountain in the world at 26,660 ft (8,126m), is located in the western Himalayas of Pakistan. Known as the 'Killer Mountain' due to its challenging conditions and high fatality rate, Nanga Parbat is famous for its dramatic Rupal and Diamir faces. The standard ascent is via the Diamir Face, involving technical climbing, exposure to avalanches, and unpredictable weather. Climbers experience remote wilderness, local culture, and the thrill of summiting one of the world's most formidable peaks.

data.title: Annapurna
data.description: Annapurna, the tenth highest mountain in the world at 26,545 ft (8,091m), is located in the Annapurna Himalayas of Nepal. It was the first eight-thousander to be climbed, in 1950. The Annapurna Expedition is renowned for its technical difficulty, avalanche risk, and remote wilderness. The standard ascent route is via the North Face. Climbers experience dramatic Himalayan vistas, rich local culture, and the challenge of one of the world's most dangerous peaks.

data.title: Gasherbrum I (Hidden Peak; K5)
data.description: Gasherbrum I, also known as Hidden Peak or K5, is the eleventh highest mountain in the world at 26,510 ft (8,080m), located in the Karakoram range on the border of Pakistan and China. The standard ascent is via the northwest ridge from Pakistan. The expedition is renowned for its remote wilderness, technical climbing, and unpredictable weather. Climbers experience dramatic glacier landscapes and the challenge of summiting one of the world's highest peaks.

data.title: Broad Peak
data.description: Broad Peak, the twelfth highest mountain in the world at 26,414 ft (8,051m), is located in the Karakoram range on the border of Pakistan and China. Named for its extensive summit ridge, Broad Peak is renowned for its remote wilderness, technical climbing, and unpredictable weather. The standard ascent is via the West Ridge from Pakistan, with dramatic glacier landscapes and the challenge of summiting one of the world's highest peaks.

data.title: Shishapangma
data.description: Shishapangma, the fourteenth highest mountain in the world at 26,335 ft (8,027m), is located entirely in Tibet (China). It is the only eight-thousander situated wholly within Chinese territory. The standard ascent is via the Northwest Ridge, making it a popular objective for climbers seeking their first 8,000-meter peak. The expedition features remote wilderness, dramatic Himalayan vistas, and the challenge of high-altitude mountaineering.
